analyzed: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje thal mo bcings la de nyid sgeg pas snying ga'i phyogs su bcings te /
translated: Then, binding the vajra palms together in the same way, one should bind them at the heart with a smile,

original: dri chus byug pa'i tshul gyis rab tu sbyar la ;
analyzed: dri chus byug pa'i tshul gyis rab tu sbyar la ;
translated: and apply them with the gesture of anointing with perfume,

original: rdo rje thal mo bcings la spyi bor gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo bcings la spyi bor gzung bar bya'o //
translated: and bind the vajra palms together and hold them at the crown of the head.

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpa'i las kyi phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should bind the action seal of Vajrasattva.

original: de nas rdo rje snyems ma'i snying po brjod cing rdo rje khu tshur gyis snyim pa gnyis bcings bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje snyems ma'i snying po brjod cing rdo rje khu tshur gyis snyim pa gnyis bcings bar bya ste /
translated: Then, reciting the essence mantra of Vajragarvi, one should bind the two fists with the vajra fist,

original: 'di ni gsang ba'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya bzhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsang ba'i mchod pa'i phyag rgya bzhi ba'o //
translated: and this is the fourth secret offering seal.

original: lha mo rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgya dang / gang zhig mchod pa'i phyag rgya dang de rnams kyi khyad par gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di la khyad par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgya dang / gang zhig mchod pa'i phyag rgya dang de rnams kyi khyad par gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di la khyad par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The difference should be stated as follows:

original: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i snying po bzla zhing gar byas nas las kyi phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i snying po bzla zhing gar byas nas las kyi phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Having recited the essence-mantras of Vajraghanta and so forth, and having danced, one should bind the karma-seals.

original: rdo rje glu len @148a * //
analyzed: rdo rje glu len @148a * //
translated: Having sung the vajra-song and danced,

original: cing gar byas nas mthar rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i snying po bzlas nas mchod pa'i phyag rgya rnams bcing bar bya'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: cing gar byas nas mthar rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i snying po bzlas nas mchod pa'i phyag rgya rnams bcing bar bya'o zhes bya ste /
translated: and having recited the essence-mantras of Vajraghanta and so forth, one should bind the offering-seals.

original: khyad par 'di yin no //
analyzed: khyad par 'di yin no //
translated: This is the difference.

original: gsang ba'i mchod pa rnams rdo rje sems dpa'i las kyi phyag rgya las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i khyad par gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang ba'i mchod pa rnams rdo rje sems dpa'i las kyi phyag rgya las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di'i khyad par gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The secret offerings arise from the karma-seals of Vajrasattva. This is the second difference.

original: de ltar rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: Thus, the secret worship of Vajra Weapon and so on, distinguished by Vajra Weapon and so on, is the fourth.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid la yang dag par mchod la mthar sgeg mo dga' ba'i rdo rje ma gsang ba'i phyag rgyas phyag 'tshal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid la yang dag par mchod la mthar sgeg mo dga' ba'i rdo rje ma gsang ba'i phyag rgyas phyag 'tshal bar bya'o //
translated: One should worship oneself who is endowed with the yoga of Vajrasattva and so on with the secret worship of Vajra Weapon and so on, and finally one should pay homage with the secret seal of Vajra Lāsyā.

original: sgeg mo dga' ba'i rdo rje ma de khyad par ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgeg mo dga' ba'i rdo rje ma de khyad par ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction of that Vajra Lāsyā?

original: bzhad pa dang bcas pa'i zhal dang spyan g-yo ba gang yin pa des 'dud pa'am yang na spyi bo bkug pas phyag 'tshal ba gang yin pa 'di'i sgeg mo dga' ba'i rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: bzhad pa dang bcas pa'i zhal dang spyan g-yo ba gang yin pa des 'dud pa'am yang na spyi bo bkug pas phyag 'tshal ba gang yin pa 'di'i sgeg mo dga' ba'i rdo rje ma'o //
translated: She is the Vajra Lāsyā who bows with a face and eyes that are smiling, or who pays homage with her head bent down.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings la phyag 'tshal ba'i glu len cing phyag 'tshal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings la phyag 'tshal ba'i glu len cing phyag 'tshal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: With this one should pay homage singing the song of homage, having formed the great seal of the Blessed One.

original: phyag 'tshal ba des ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba des ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does this homage work?

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang dgyes pas dga' ba thams cad la sogs pa'i bde ba thams cad dang yid bde ba'i dngos grub thams cad stsol ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang dgyes pas dga' ba thams cad la sogs pa'i bde ba thams cad dang yid bde ba'i dngos grub thams cad stsol ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Blessed One, Vajradhara, is pleased, and grants all powers of bliss and mental satisfaction, such as all joys.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i yid bde ba'i khyad par ba spu ldang ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i yid bde ba'i khyad par ba spu ldang ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni dga' ba yin no //
translated: Therein, joy is the cause of the hairs standing on end, which is the distinction between the mental satisfaction with and without impurity.

original: bde ba ni lus kyi tshor ba bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni lus kyi tshor ba bde ba'o //
translated: Bliss is the bodily feeling of pleasure.

original: de las gzhan pa sems kyi tshor ba bde ba ni yid bde ba'o//
analyzed: de las gzhan pa sems kyi tshor ba bde ba ni yid bde ba'o//
translated: Mental satisfaction is the mental feeling of pleasure, which is different from that.

original: dga' ba thams cad la sogs pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba gang la thog mar yod pa de ni /
analyzed: dga' ba thams cad la sogs pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba gang la thog mar yod pa de ni /
translated: That which has all joys, etc., bliss and mental satisfaction at the beginning,

original: dga' ba thams cad la sogs pa'i bde ba thams cad dang yid bde ba rnams so //
analyzed: dga' ba thams cad la sogs pa'i bde ba thams cad dang yid bde ba rnams so //
translated: is all the joys, etc., bliss and mental satisfaction.

original: de dag gi dngos grub ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste dngos grub de rnams sgeg mo dga' ba'i rdo rje mas rdo rje 'chang chen po la phyag 'tshal nas sgrub pa po la stsol ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos grub ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste dngos grub de rnams sgeg mo dga' ba'i rdo rje mas rdo rje 'chang chen po la phyag 'tshal nas sgrub pa po la stsol ba yin no //
translated: Their powers are complete, and those powers are bestowed on the practitioner by the Vajra Lady of Delight, having bowed to Great Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor bris nas rang dang gzhan gyi cho ga thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dkyil 'khor bris nas rang dang gzhan gyi cho ga thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas la /
translated: With respect to the vajra-binding, etc., having drawn the mandala, one should complete all the rites for oneself and others.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa'i dus sam bsgrub pa'i dus su bzlas pa dang bsgom @148b pas ;
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa'i dus sam bsgrub pa'i dus su bzlas pa dang bsgom @148b pas ;
translated: At the time of the preliminary service or at the time of the rite, one should recite and meditate.

original: slob dpon nam slob ma skyo bar gyur pas lha gshegs su gsol 'dod na /
analyzed: slob dpon nam slob ma skyo bar gyur pas lha gshegs su gsol 'dod na /
translated: If the master or the disciple wishes to request the departure of the deity because of fatigue,

original: de'i tshe rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas rang gi lha'i snying po bzla zhing rang gi snying ga'i phyogs su bde bar bcings la badzra mu: zhes bya ba 'dis dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas rang gi lha'i snying po bzla zhing rang gi snying ga'i phyogs su bde bar bcings la badzra mu: zhes bya ba 'dis dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: at that time, having bound the vajra-binding, one should recite one's deity's essence and bind it comfortably in the region of one's heart, and one should release it with this [mantra], vajra-muḥ.

original: phyag rgya thams cad rang rang gi gnas su dgrol bar bsams na /
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad rang rang gi gnas su dgrol bar bsams na /
translated: If one wishes to release all the seals in their own places,🔽one should recite this [mantra], vajra-muḥ.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya thams cad dkrol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya thams cad dkrol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, all the maṇḍala mudrās are released.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i dus su yang rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis rang gi lha'i phyag rgya thams cad kyang dkrol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa la sogs pa'i dus su yang rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis rang gi lha'i phyag rgya thams cad kyang dkrol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, at the time of the preliminary approach and so forth, all the mudrās of the yogins’ deities are released.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i bsgom pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i bsgom pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “By meditating on Vajrasattva” and so forth.

original: badzra badzra zhes brjod cing bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' bsgoms la rdul tshon gyi re kh'a dang / thig skud kyi re kh'a dang / rdo rje dang rigs thams cad phyag mtshan yid kyis gyen du bteg la /
analyzed: badzra badzra zhes brjod cing bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' bsgoms la rdul tshon gyi re kh'a dang / thig skud kyi re kh'a dang / rdo rje dang rigs thams cad phyag mtshan yid kyis gyen du bteg la /
translated: Reciting vajra vajra, one meditates on oneself as Vajrasattva, and mentally raises up the lines of colored powder, the lines of the thread, and the vajra and all the insignia of the clans.

original: rdo rje shugs kyis dkyil 'khor gyi nang du 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: rdo rje shugs kyis dkyil 'khor gyi nang du 'jug pa'am /
translated: With the speed of a vajra, one enters into the maṇḍala or

original: phyir 'byung bar byas nas rnal 'byor pa'i dam tshig nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir 'byung bar byas nas rnal 'byor pa'i dam tshig nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: exits, and the yogin’s sacred commitments are not impaired.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom pas dkyil 'khor phyag na dam tshig nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor bris nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom pas dkyil 'khor phyag na dam tshig nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis dkyil 'khor bris nas /
translated: Having drawn the mandala in the manner previously explained,

original: cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la phyag rgya bkrol bar byas nas lha thams cad gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la phyag rgya bkrol bar byas nas lha thams cad gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: one should perform all the rites, release the seals, and request the departure of all the deities.

original: de nas sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor rang gi lus la bcug ste /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor rang gi lus la bcug ste /
translated: Then, having caused the emanated mandala to enter one's body,

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can gyi ra ba la sogs pa ji ltar bris pa rdo rje sems dpa'i snying po brjod cing chags na dam tshig nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can gyi ra ba la sogs pa ji ltar bris pa rdo rje sems dpa'i snying po brjod cing chags na dam tshig nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one should recite the essence mantra of Vajrasattva, and if one is attached to the enclosure and so forth which have the nature of color and shape as drawn, there is no transgression of sacred pledge.🔽Then, the tantra called the Karmamudra.

original: de nas las kyi phyag rgya'i rgyud ces bya ba la de nas kyi sgra ni skabs la bab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas las kyi phyag rgya'i rgyud ces bya ba la de nas kyi sgra ni skabs la bab pa'o //
translated: The word then indicates the proper time.

original: las sgrub par byed pa'i phyag rgya ni las kyi phyag rgya ste de rnams ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rgyud de /
analyzed: las sgrub par byed pa'i phyag rgya ni las kyi phyag rgya ste de rnams ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rgyud de /
translated: The karmamudra is the seal that accomplishes karma, and the collection of words that teach those is the tantra.

original: de 'di ltar yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de 'di ltar yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: “Thus” is a remainder of the sentence.

original: de ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The great-bliss vajra, etc.

original: dang po'i rdo rje ni bde ba chen po'i rdo rje ste de bcings la spyi bor 'dzin na bdag nyid bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje ni bde ba chen po'i rdo rje ste de bcings la spyi bor 'dzin na bdag nyid bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The first vajra is the great-bliss vajra. Binding it and holding it at the crown of the head, one protects oneself.

original: dpral bar 'dzin na gzhan bsrung bar 'gyur ro //🔽snying ga'i phyogs su phab nas bzhag na phyogs thams cad du 'bar ba'i rnam pa can gyi byed @149a * //
analyzed: dpral bar 'dzin na gzhan bsrung bar 'gyur ro // snying ga'i phyogs su phab nas bzhag na phyogs thams cad du 'bar ba'i rnam pa can gyi byed @149a * //
translated: Holding it at the forehead, one protects others.

original: pa dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Placing it at the heart region, one should imagine that it becomes a blazing vajra, blazing with the aspect of fire, and that it has the function of burning all directions.🔽Even the wrathful kings of the vajras are unable to enter it.

original: rdo rje khro ba'i rgyal po rnams kyis kyang 'jug par mi nus so zhes bya bar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje khro ba'i rgyal po rnams kyis kyang 'jug par mi nus so zhes bya bar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so //
translated: Thus has the Blessed One, Vajrasattva, declared.

original: 'dis ni phyogs dang mtshams thams cad dang dkyil 'khor bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs dang mtshams thams cad dang dkyil 'khor bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, one binds all directions and intermediate directions and the maṇḍala.

original: snying gar bsgom pa rdo rje dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying gar bsgom pa rdo rje dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The heart-meditation is together with the vajra.

original: de nyid snying ga'i phyogs su bzhag la rang rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsgom bar byas na bdud thams cad kyi stobs 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid snying ga'i phyogs su bzhag la rang rang gi snying ga'i zla ba la rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsgom bar byas na bdud thams cad kyi stobs 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one places it in the region of the heart, and visualizes a five-pronged vajra on the moon at one’s heart, one will destroy the power of all demons.

original: gyen du kha blta ba btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid bcings nas de'i dbus ma'i rdo rje'i steng du kha bltas par bzhag nas 'thungs na tshe 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyen du kha blta ba btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de nyid bcings nas de'i dbus ma'i rdo rje'i steng du kha bltas par bzhag nas 'thungs na tshe 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “ Drinking it with the face turned upward” means that, binding it as before, one should place it with the face turned upward on the central vajra, and drink it; one’s life will be extended.

original: rang gi gdong yongs su sbyangs nas gdong par dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba la dang po'i rdo rjes rang gi gdong ba yongs su sbyangs nas de nyid rang gi gdong pa yongs su bkrol bar byas nas /
analyzed: rang gi gdong yongs su sbyangs nas gdong par dgrol bar bya'o zhes bya ba la dang po'i rdo rjes rang gi gdong ba yongs su sbyangs nas de nyid rang gi gdong pa yongs su bkrol bar byas nas /
translated: “ Having cleansed one’s face, one should release it on the face” means that, having cleansed one’s face with the first vajra, one should release it on one’s face with that very [vajra].

original: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have a great abundance of beauty.

original: dbus ma rdo rje ldeg par yang bya'o zhes bya ba la dang po'i rdo rje dbus ma'i rdo rje ldeg bar byas nas gzi brjid 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbus ma rdo rje ldeg par yang bya'o zhes bya ba la dang po'i rdo rje dbus ma'i rdo rje ldeg bar byas nas gzi brjid 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having shaken the middle vajra of the first vajra, one's splendor will increase.

original: dpung mgo gnyis su bzhag cing snying gar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dpung mgo gnyis su bzhag cing snying gar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should place it on both shoulders and place it on the heart.

original: dang po'i rdo rje dpung mgo gnyis la bzhag nas /
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje dpung mgo gnyis la bzhag nas /
translated: Having placed the first vajra on both shoulders,

original: snying ga'i phyogs su gzugs na mdangs dang stobs 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying ga'i phyogs su gzugs na mdangs dang stobs 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if one forms it at the heart, one's luster and strength will increase.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje mda' lnga bsdus pa'i mdzub mo gnyis kyi lcags kyu gang yin pa des /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje mda' lnga bsdus pa'i mdzub mo gnyis kyi lcags kyu gang yin pa des /
translated: The two hooks of the two index fingers of the five arrows of the vajra of supreme joy,

original: cod pan dang dar dpyangs bcings pa'i dbang bskur ba mthong ba'i tshul byas nas /
analyzed: cod pan dang dar dpyangs bcings pa'i dbang bskur ba mthong ba'i tshul byas nas /
translated: having made the appearance of receiving the consecration of the crown and the hanging ribbons,

original: dbang bskur ba thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will obtain all consecrations.

original: skye gnas las dong tshe 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye gnas las dong tshe 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should draw out the arrow from the place of birth.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags las dong tshe 'byin pa'i tshul bstan na /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags las dong tshe 'byin pa'i tshul bstan na /
translated: Having demonstrated the drawing out of the arrow from one's sign with the vajra of supreme joy,

original: nor rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain wealth.

original: spyi bor gzhag par bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje spyi bor bzung na rgyal srid rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi bor gzhag par bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje spyi bor bzung na rgyal srid rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should place it on the head. If one holds the delighted-vajra on the head, one will obtain a kingdom.

original: sa la reg par bya zhes bya zhes ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes sa la reg na thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la reg par bya zhes bya zhes ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes sa la reg na thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should touch the earth. If one touches the earth with the delighted-vajra, one will obtain it.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rtags kyi las so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rtags kyi las so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The rite of the signs with the delighted-vajra.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings te /
translated: One should bind the delighted-vajra.

original: des thams cad @149b dbab pa la sogs pa'i rang gi rtags la reg pas las rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des thams cad @149b dbab pa la sogs pa'i rang gi rtags la reg pas las rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By touching one's own signs, such as the eyes, with that, the rites will occur.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: lcags kyu zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i mdzub mo gnyis kyi lcags kyus rang gi rtags la 'dren pas thams cad dbab pa dang / sa g-yo ba dang / gar byed du bcug pa dang / dus gsum gyi bden pa smrar 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lcags kyu zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i mdzub mo gnyis kyi lcags kyus rang gi rtags la 'dren pas thams cad dbab pa dang / sa g-yo ba dang / gar byed du bcug pa dang / dus gsum gyi bden pa smrar 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The hook. If one draws one's own signs with the hook of the two thumbs of the delighted-vajra, one will cause all to descend, to shake the earth, to dance, and to speak the truth of the three times.

original: rtse mo gtod pa zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i mdzub mo gnyis kyi lcags kyus rang gi rtags kyi rtse mo gtod par byas na /
analyzed: rtse mo gtod pa zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje'i mdzub mo gnyis kyi lcags kyus rang gi rtags kyi rtse mo gtod par byas na /
translated: The pointing of the peak is as follows: One should point the peak of one's sign with the two hooks of the index fingers of the Rati-vajra.

original: pra dbab pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pra dbab pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: All evocations will be accomplished.

original: skye gnas bkrol ba'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rtags te rang gi skye gnas de la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje reg pa'i tshul gyis bkrol bar byas nas /
analyzed: skye gnas bkrol ba'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi rtags te rang gi skye gnas de la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje reg pa'i tshul gyis bkrol bar byas nas /
translated: The releasing of the birthplace is as follows: One should release one's sign, one's birthplace, with the manner of touching with the Rati-vajra.

original: gdon thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdon thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be released from all evil spirits.

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil nyed cing bsnun par bya'o zhes bya ba la /🔽rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg cing lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil g-yas pa'i mthe bos mnye zhing bsnun na gdug pa thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil nyed cing bsnun par bya'o zhes bya ba la / rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg cing lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil g-yas pa'i mthe bos mnye zhing bsnun na gdug pa thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should rub and press with the palm of the left hand.🔽 One should rub and press with the thumb of the right hand on one's sign, which is touched with the Rati-vajra, with the palm of the left hand. All evil spirits will be destroyed.🔽 One should squeeze.

original: btsir bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags btsir na thams cad rengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btsir bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags btsir na thams cad rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should squeeze one's sign with the Rati-vajra. All will be paralyzed.

original: mig btsum par bya'o zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg cing mig btsums par byas na thams cad gnyid log tu bcug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig btsum par bya'o zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg cing mig btsums par byas na thams cad gnyid log tu bcug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase one should close one's eyes means that if one touches one's sign with Pramudita-vajra and closes one's eyes, all will fall asleep.

original: bskor zhing btsir nas rdo rje khro bo'i lta bas blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /🔽rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg cing de ltar gtod par byas nas btsir te /
analyzed: bskor zhing btsir nas rdo rje khro bo'i lta bas blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la / rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg cing de ltar gtod par byas nas btsir te /
translated: The phrase one should look with the gaze of Vajra Wrath, turning and pressing means that🔽one touches one's sign with Pramudita-vajra, and having thus focused, one presses with the gaze of Vajra Wrath, with a frown and a fierce stare.

original: rab tu gtsigs shing khro gnyer bsdus pa'i khro bo'i mig gi lta bas bsgrub bya la bltas na thams cad la rgyas btab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu gtsigs shing khro gnyer bsdus pa'i khro bo'i mig gi lta bas bsgrub bya la bltas na thams cad la rgyas btab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one looks at the victim, all will be sealed.

original: yongs su bskor nas kha'i mthar mche ba bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su bskor nas kha'i mthar mche ba bstan pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase turning, one should show one's fangs at the edge of one's mouth means that🔽one touches one's sign with Pramudita-vajra, turns, and holds with the manner of showing one's fangs at the two edges of one's mouth.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg nas bskor te kha'i mtha' gnyis su mche ba ston pa'i tshul gyis gzung na thams cad gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg nas bskor te kha'i mtha' gnyis su mche ba ston pa'i tshul gyis gzung na thams cad gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does this, all will be killed.

original: g-yas pa'i mdzub mos sdigs mdzub bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yas pa'i mdzub mos sdigs mdzub bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The right forefinger should be threatening.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg cing g-yas pa'i mdzub mos bsgrub bya la sdigs @150a * //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rjes rang gi rtags la reg cing g-yas pa'i mdzub mos bsgrub bya la sdigs @150a * //
translated: Having formed the Utterly Joyful Vajra, touch one's own sign with it, and threaten the victim with the right forefinger.

original: mdzub byas na thams cad ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdzub byas na thams cad ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All will fall.

original: mdzub mos sa las ldang bar bya'o zhes bya la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings nas /
analyzed: mdzub mos sa las ldang bar bya'o zhes bya la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings nas /
translated: The forefinger should rise from the earth.🔽Having formed the Utterly Joyful Vajra, touch one's own sign with it, and make the right forefinger rise.

original: de yis rang gi rtags la reg cing g-yas pa'i mdzub mos bslang bar byas la des bsgrub bya las bslang ba byas na thams cad bslang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yis rang gi rtags la reg cing g-yas pa'i mdzub mos bslang bar byas la des bsgrub bya las bslang ba byas na thams cad bslang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, all will rise.🔽The thumbs should be bound.🔽Having formed the Utterly Joyful Vajra, touch one's own sign with it, and bind the thumbs.

original: mthe bong mthe bo bcing bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings nas de yis rang gi rtags la reg cing mthe bo bcing bar byas na thams cad 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthe bong mthe bo bcing bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings nas de yis rang gi rtags la reg cing mthe bo bcing bar byas na thams cad 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, all will be bound.🔽The mudra is released by the syllable muh.

original: yi ge mu: yis phyag rgya bkrol ba'o zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings nas /
analyzed: yi ge mu: yis phyag rgya bkrol ba'o zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings nas /
translated: Having formed the Utterly Joyful Vajra, touch one's own sign with it, and release the thumbs.

original: de yis rang gi rtags la bzhag ste /
analyzed: de yis rang gi rtags la bzhag ste /
translated: Having placed it on one’s own sign,

original: aom ma h'a su kha badzra satva dza: h'um bam ho:/
analyzed: aom ma h'a su kha badzra satva dza: h'um bam ho:/
translated: one should recite the mantra, “Oṃ, great bliss, vajra being, jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, surate samayas tvam, muḥ.”

original: su ra te stvam mu: zhes bya ba brjod cing thams cad dgrol ba'i bsam pas rang gi rtags bkrol bar byas na de ltar thams cad dgrol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su ra te stvam mu: zhes bya ba brjod cing thams cad dgrol ba'i bsam pas rang gi rtags bkrol bar byas na de ltar thams cad dgrol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having released one’s own sign with the thought of releasing all, one should release all in that way.

original: dang po'i rdo rje mthe'u chung gi rdo rjes bsnun par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje mthe'u chung gi rdo rjes bsnun par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should strike with the vajra of the small finger of the original vajra.

original: dang po'i rdo rje'i mthe'u chung gnyis kyi rtse mos bsgrub bya la brdeg par byas na de ltar na phra men ma thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje'i mthe'u chung gnyis kyi rtse mos bsgrub bya la brdeg par byas na de ltar na phra men ma thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having struck the one to be liberated with the tips of the two small fingers of the original vajra, one should release all the ḍākinīs in that way.

original: de nyid rnam par 'gyur pa'i gdong pas so zhes bya ba la dang po'i rdo rje bcings nas /

translated: The explanation is to be applied to each one:

original: rdo rje yid las byung ba bshad pa dang / k'i li k'i la'i bshad pa dang / rdo rje chu srin bshad pa dang / rdo rje snyems ma bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'o //🔽rdo rje bsdams pa mdzub mo rdo rjes so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje yid las byung ba bshad pa dang / k'i li k'i la'i bshad pa dang / rdo rje chu srin bshad pa dang / rdo rje snyems ma bshad pa'o zhes bya ba'o // rdo rje bsdams pa mdzub mo rdo rjes so zhes bya ba la /
translated: the explanation of Vajrāmṛta, the explanation of Kali Kali, the explanation of Vajrāmā, and the explanation of Vajragarvā.🔽The vajra-bound index fingers.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mor yang dag par sbyar bar byas na /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mor yang dag par sbyar bar byas na /
translated: Having bound the vajra-bound, the tips of the two index fingers should be joined.

original: des rmi lam 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rmi lam 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one will cause dreams.

original: ji ltar zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ;
translated: How?

original: gsol ba 'debs par byed pas zhes bya ba la mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo de nyid gsol ba btab pa'i tshul gyis bzung na rmi lam 'bebs pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs par byed pas zhes bya ba la mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo de nyid gsol ba btab pa'i tshul gyis bzung na rmi lam 'bebs pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: By supplicating. The tips of the two index fingers should be held in the manner of supplicating. That accomplishes the causing of dreams.

original: mdzub mo gnyis kyis rang gi mig gnyis bkab lam btsums par bsgoms nas gang mngon par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis kyis rang gi mig gnyis bkab lam btsums par bsgoms nas gang mngon par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should meditate on one’s eyes being covered by the two index fingers, and one should close one’s eyes.🔽One should meditate on the Bhagavat in front of oneself, as one desires, having bound the vajra fist and covered one’s eyes with the two index fingers, without closing one’s eyes.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis kyis rang gi mig gnyis bkab la mig ma btsums par ji ltar 'dod pa'i bcom ldan 'das mdun du bsgom par byas na gzhan rnams la rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i rmi lam ston par byed @154a * //🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis kyis rang gi mig gnyis bkab la mig ma btsums par ji ltar 'dod pa'i bcom ldan 'das mdun du bsgom par byas na gzhan rnams la rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i rmi lam ston par byed @154a * // pa yin no //
translated: One will show one’s desired dream to others.

original: sbyin sreg byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin sreg byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should perform the rite of homa.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis yang dag par sbyar ba'i rtse mos sbyin sreg byed pa'i tshul byas na //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis yang dag par sbyar ba'i rtse mos sbyin sreg byed pa'i tshul byas na //
translated: Having bound the vajra fist, one should make the form of performing homa with the tips of the two index fingers joined together.

original: 'dis rmi lam ngan pa thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis rmi lam ngan pa thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, all bad dreams will be destroyed.

original: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mos rang gi mig bkab na rmi lam bzang po thams cad brtan par sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mos rang gi mig bkab na rmi lam bzang po thams cad brtan par sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one covers one’s eyes with the tips of the two index fingers, one will accomplish all good dreams.

original: so rnams kyis gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo yang dag par sbyar bar bya ste so rnams kyis gzung ba byas na 'dis 'bras dang nad thams cad 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so rnams kyis gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo yang dag par sbyar bar bya ste so rnams kyis gzung ba byas na 'dis 'bras dang nad thams cad 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should hold the teeth means that having bound the vajra fist, one should join the tips of the two index fingers and hold the teeth with them. By this, one will remove all diseases and afflictions.

original: btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should drink means

original: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo de nyid btung ba'i tshul du byas na nad thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo de nyid btung ba'i tshul du byas na nad thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: that having joined the tips of the two index fingers in the manner of drinking, all diseases will be pacified.

original: rtse mo bskyod cing sbyin sreg bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtse mo bskyod cing sbyin sreg bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should make an offering with the tips [of the index fingers] moving means

original: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo kha la bskyod cing sbyin sreg gi tshul du byas nas 'dis dus ma yin par 'chi ba zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo kha la bskyod cing sbyin sreg gi tshul du byas nas 'dis dus ma yin par 'chi ba zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: that having moved the tips of the two index fingers to the mouth in the manner of making an offering, by this untimely death will be pacified.

original: rang gi mthe bo 'og tu rab tu brkyang la brdeg bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo yang dag par sbyar bar byas te /
analyzed: rang gi mthe bo 'og tu rab tu brkyang la brdeg bar bya'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo yang dag par sbyar bar byas te /
translated: One should strike with the lower [part of the] thumb extended means that having bound the vajra fist, one should join the tips of the two index fingers and extend the thumbs downward.

original: mthe bo gnyis 'og tu mnyam por byas la brkyang ste mthe bong gnyis po des sdig pa la brdeg par byas na ngan song gsum po dral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthe bo gnyis 'og tu mnyam por byas la brkyang ste mthe bong gnyis po des sdig pa la brdeg par byas na ngan song gsum po dral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The two thumbs are even and extended below, and with those two thumbs one strikes the evil one, and the three lower realms are split open.

original: rdo rje sku mchog gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje sku mchog gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mudra called “supreme vajra body” is as follows:

original: gang zhig rdo rje'i sku'i mchog tu gyur pa'i phyag rgya des sku thams cad kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig rdo rje'i sku'i mchog tu gyur pa'i phyag rgya des sku thams cad kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that mudra which is supreme vajra body, one attains the power of all bodies.

original: des ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: des ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mthe bo sems dpa'i skyil krung gis /
analyzed: mthe bo sems dpa'i skyil krung gis /
translated: The thumbs in the sattva cross-legged position,

original: mdzub mo'i rdo rje'i sku mchog go //
analyzed: mdzub mo'i rdo rje'i sku mchog go //
translated: the index fingers are the supreme vajra body.

original: zhes bya ba la rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mthe bo g-yon pa'i steng du mthe bo g-yas sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gi tshul gyis bzhag la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mthe bo g-yon pa'i steng du mthe bo g-yas sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gi tshul gyis bzhag la /
translated: Having bound the vajra binding, the right thumb is placed on top of the left thumb in the manner of the sattva cross-legged position,

original: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo yang dag par sbyar ba byas na 'dis rdo rje sku'i mchog ste 'dis sku thams cad kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo yang dag par sbyar ba byas na 'dis rdo rje sku'i mchog ste 'dis sku thams cad kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the tips of the two index fingers are joined together. By this, the supreme vajra body, one attains the power of all bodies.

original: dbus ma'i mnyam pa'i kha dbus kyi ngag 'byin pa zhes bya ba la rdo rje sku'i mchog gi phyag rgya'i sor mo dbus ma gnyis kyi me tog gi mgo lcogs kyi tshul byas te phyag @154b rgya 'dis ngag 'byin pa'i tshul gyis kha la gyen du bsgreng bar
analyzed: dbus ma'i mnyam pa'i kha dbus kyi ngag 'byin pa zhes bya ba la rdo rje sku'i mchog gi phyag rgya'i sor mo dbus ma gnyis kyi me tog gi mgo lcogs kyi tshul byas te phyag @154b rgya 'dis ngag 'byin pa'i tshul gyis kha la gyen du bsgreng bar
translated: Having made the flower-bud gesture with the middle fingers of the supreme vajra-body gesture, one should open the mouth with this gesture.

original: byas na ngag gi dngos grub thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas na ngag gi dngos grub thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does this, one will accomplish all the powers of speech.

original: snying gar bzhag nas aom bo dhi tsitta au tp'a da y'a mi zhes bya ba bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying gar bzhag nas aom bo dhi tsitta au tp'a da y'a mi zhes bya ba bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having placed it at the heart, one should meditate on the mantra “oṃ bodhicittot pāda yāmī.”

original: rdo rje sku mchog bcings nas rang gi snying ga'i phyogs su bzung ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sku mchog bcings nas rang gi snying ga'i phyogs su bzung ste /
translated: Having made the supreme vajra-body gesture and held it at one’s heart,

original: aom bo dhi tsitta autp'a da y'a mi zhes bya ba brjod cing rang gi snying gar sems dpa'i rdo rje bsgom par byas nas thugs kyi dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom bo dhi tsitta autp'a da y'a mi zhes bya ba brjod cing rang gi snying gar sems dpa'i rdo rje bsgom par byas nas thugs kyi dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: one should recite “oṃ bodhicittot pāda yāmī” and meditate on the bodhi-vajra at one’s heart.

original: mthe bo'i rtags g-yon pa'i mthe bo'i bu gar gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthe bo'i rtags g-yon pa'i mthe bo'i bu gar gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sign of the thumb is inserting the left thumb into the right thumb aperture.

original: sku mchog bcings nas g-yon pa'i mthe bo'i bu gang g-yas pa'i mthe bo 'og tu kha blta ba bcug na thams cad kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku mchog bcings nas g-yon pa'i mthe bo'i bu gang g-yas pa'i mthe bo 'og tu kha blta ba bcug na thams cad kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having bound the supreme body, if one inserts the left thumb into the right thumb aperture, facing downward, one will obtain the powers of all.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis glog 'gyu ba ltar bskor bas rdo rje'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis glog 'gyu ba ltar bskor bas rdo rje'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas /
translated: The vajra wheel is whirling with both vajra fists like lightning. Having bound both vajra fists,

original: de nyid glog 'gyu ba'i tshul gyis bskor bar byas na sa 'dis dkyil 'khor thams cad la gzhug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid glog 'gyu ba'i tshul gyis bskor bar byas na sa 'dis dkyil 'khor thams cad la gzhug par 'gyur ro //
translated: if one whirls them in the manner of lightning, one will enter all maṇḍalas with this mudrā.

original: rdo rje snyems ma dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las byung ba'i phyag rgya rdo rje dang bcas pa bcings nas /
analyzed: rdo rje snyems ma dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las byung ba'i phyag rgya rdo rje dang bcas pa bcings nas /
translated: Together with the vajra pride. Having bound the mudrā that arises from both vajra fists of the Blessed One, Vajrasattva, together with the vajra,

original: 'dis phyag rgya thams cad bcing ba'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis phyag rgya thams cad bcing ba'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will obtain the power of binding all mudrās with this.

original: yi ge h'um gis sdigs mdzub bya'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas yi ge h'um brjod pa dang bcas pas mdzub mo gnyis so sor bsgreng ste sdigs mdzub byas na des dam tshig thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge h'um gis sdigs mdzub bya'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas yi ge h'um brjod pa dang bcas pas mdzub mo gnyis so sor bsgreng ste sdigs mdzub byas na des dam tshig thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, all pledges are accomplished.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i las rdo rje gar gyi tshul gyis kha sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i las rdo rje gar gyi tshul gyis kha sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The kiss is the dance posture of the action vajra.🔽 Having formed the action vajra, one should rise in the manner of dancing, and place the palms together at the crown of the head.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings nas gar gyi tshul gyis langs te spyi bor thal mo kha sbyar ba byas nas 'dis ni las thams cad kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje bcings nas gar gyi tshul gyis langs te spyi bor thal mo kha sbyar ba byas nas 'dis ni las thams cad kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one attains the power of all actions.

original: rdo rje snyems ma bshad pa'o zhes bya ba la dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i las kyi phyag rgya ni /
analyzed: rdo rje snyems ma bshad pa'o zhes bya ba la dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i las kyi phyag rgya ni /
translated: The explanation of Vajragarvi is the action seal of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje snyems ma ste des las kyi dngos grub thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje snyems ma ste des las kyi dngos grub thams cad thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one attains the power of all actions.

original: mthe chung gi ngos kyis mdud pa'i mdzub mo mnyam pa rtse mo yongs su bskor te 'og nas bteg pa la mdzub mo mnyam pa'i rtse @155a * //
analyzed: mthe chung gi ngos kyis mdud pa'i mdzub mo mnyam pa rtse mo yongs su bskor te 'og nas bteg pa la mdzub mo mnyam pa'i rtse @155a * //
translated: The two little fingers are crossed at the tips and the two index fingers are completely encircled by the tips of the two middle fingers.🔽If one raises the two index fingers to the place of consecration, this is the vajra hair-tuft.

original: mo dbang bskur ba'i gnas su bzhag na rdo rje mdzod spu'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas /
analyzed: mo dbang bskur ba'i gnas su bzhag na rdo rje mdzod spu'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas /
translated: Having formed the two vajra fists,🔽cross the two little fingers on the ground and join the two index fingers together, facing each other, and raise them up.

original: mthe'u chung gnyis phan tshun du sa la mdud pa byas na mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo'i steng du kha blta bar yang dag par sbyar nas 'og nas bteg la dbang bskur ba'i gnas su gzung bar byas na 'dis phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob par 'gyur
analyzed: mthe'u chung gnyis phan tshun du sa la mdud pa byas na mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo'i steng du kha blta bar yang dag par sbyar nas 'og nas bteg la dbang bskur ba'i gnas su gzung bar byas na 'dis phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob par 'gyur
translated: If one holds them at the place of consecration, one will obtain all perfections.

original: ro // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khu tshur ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ro // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khu tshur ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The vajra fist of all tathāgatas will be explained below.

original: dum bu 'di gnyis kyi rgyud phyi ma las rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las byung ba'i byang chub mchog ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khu tshur du 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: dum bu 'di gnyis kyi rgyud phyi ma las rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las byung ba'i byang chub mchog ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khu tshur du 'chad pa yin no //
translated: The Continuation of the Continuation of the Compendium of Principles Tantra explains that the supreme enlightenment arising from the two vajra fists is the vajra fist of all the Ones-Gone-Thus.

original: de bcings nas ye shes thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bcings nas ye shes thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having bound that, one attains all exalted wisdoms.🔽The vajra dance is explained.

original: rdo rje gar ni bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te /
analyzed: rdo rje gar ni bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba la rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te /
translated: Having bound the two vajra fists,

original: sgeg pa dang bcas pa thams cad la sogs pa bkrol bas klog 'gyu ba'i gar gyis g-yas su bskor ba gang yin pa de ni rdo rje gar ma ste /
analyzed: sgeg pa dang bcas pa thams cad la sogs pa bkrol bas klog 'gyu ba'i gar gyis g-yas su bskor ba gang yin pa de ni rdo rje gar ma ste /
translated: through releasing the dance movements of all the flirtations and so forth, whatever is done clockwise with the dance movements of the vajra dance is the vajra dance.

original: des ni thams cad kyis mchod par bya ba nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni thams cad kyis mchod par bya ba nyid 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through that, one attains the state of being worshipped by all.

original: mdzub mo phyir phyogs pa bslang ba'i rdo rje snying gar badzra h'um zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdzub mo phyir phyogs pa bslang ba'i rdo rje snying gar badzra h'um zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The extended vajra with the index fingers extended is at the heart with vajra hūṃ.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings mdzub mo gnyis phyir blta ba bslang ste rtse mo yang dag par sbyar nas snying ga'i phyogs su bzung zhing badzro& ham zhes bya ba bsams nas rdo rje thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings mdzub mo gnyis phyir blta ba bslang ste rtse mo yang dag par sbyar nas snying ga'i phyogs su bzung zhing badzro& ham zhes bya ba bsams nas rdo rje thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Form the two vajra fists, extend the two index fingers, and touch the tips together. Holding this at the heart, and thinking vajro’haṃ, one will attain the supreme attainment of all vajras.

original: ye shes kyi khu tshur gyis ta th'a ga to& ham zhes bya ba la byang chub mchog bcings nas ta th'a ga to& ham zhes bya ba la bsgoms na 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khu tshur gyis ta th'a ga to& ham zhes bya ba la byang chub mchog bcings nas ta th'a ga to& ham zhes bya ba la bsgoms na 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog gi dngos grub 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Forming the supreme enlightenment mudra with the gnosis fist, and meditating on tathaagato’haṃ, one will attain the supreme attainment of all tathagatas.

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya chen po bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya chen po bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The characteristics of the karma mudra are explained as the great mudra of the Bhagavat.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po ni bshad zin pa ste /
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen po ni bshad zin pa ste /
translated: The great mudra of glorious Vajrasattva has been explained.

original: des rdo rje 'chang ba chen po'i mchog gi dngos grub thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rdo rje 'chang ba chen po'i mchog gi dngos grub thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, one attains all the supreme powers of Great Vajradhara.

original: las kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid thams cad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid thams cad bstan pa yin no //
translated: All the characteristics of the karma consort are taught.

original: rdo rje med pa'i rdo rje khu tshur rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje med pa'i rdo rje khu tshur rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One should bind the karma mudra of all the vajra fists without vajras.

original: rdo rje khu tshur @155b de dag bskyed pa'i rgyu bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur @155b de dag bskyed pa'i rgyu bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the cause for generating those vajra fists,

original: de nas rdo rje khu tshur bcing ba'o //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje khu tshur bcing ba'o // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: then, the binding of the vajra fist.

original: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: The word then expresses immediacy.

original: rang gi rdo rje khu tshur gyis phyag rgya rnams gang las byung ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di bskyed pas de ma thag kho nar rdo rje khu tshur gyi phyag rgya 'ching ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'ching ba zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi rdo rje khu tshur gyis phyag rgya rnams gang las byung ba zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di bskyed pas de ma thag kho nar rdo rje khu tshur gyi phyag rgya 'ching ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'ching ba zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: Since the thought “from where do these mudras arise?” is generated, immediately after that, the characteristic of binding the mudra of the vajra fist is called binding.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rdo rje bsdams pa bcings te /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rdo rje bsdams pa bcings te /
translated: The vajra-binding, etc. means that one should bind the vajra-binding as explained,

original: mthe bo gnyis rdo rje bsdams pa'i nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: mthe bo gnyis rdo rje bsdams pa'i nang du bcug ste /
translated: and insert the two thumbs into the vajra-binding.

original: rang gi mthe chung dang srin lag gi phyag rgya 'ching ba'i bar du bzhag nas mdzub mo gnyis bkug cing de'i rtse mo rang gi mthe bo'i steng du gzhag par byas nas /
analyzed: rang gi mthe chung dang srin lag gi phyag rgya 'ching ba'i bar du bzhag nas mdzub mo gnyis bkug cing de'i rtse mo rang gi mthe bo'i steng du gzhag par byas nas /
translated: Placing the little finger and ring finger in the binding of the mudra, one should bend the two index fingers and place their tips on top of one's thumbs.

original: 'dis ni dam tshig chen po'i rdo rje mchog gi khu tshur zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dam tshig chen po'i rdo rje mchog gi khu tshur zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudra called the great pledge vajra-fist.

original: thams cad dngos grub mchog stsol ba //
analyzed: thams cad dngos grub mchog stsol ba //
translated: Granting the supreme siddhi of all.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: phyag rgya thams cad 'ching ba'i dngos grub ster ba yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad 'ching ba'i dngos grub ster ba yin no //
translated: it grants the siddhi of binding all mudras.

original: de nyid du byas nas zhes bya ba de ni dam tshig rdo rje mchog gi khu tshur ro //
analyzed: de nyid du byas nas zhes bya ba de ni dam tshig rdo rje mchog gi khu tshur ro //
translated: Having made just that, etc. means that the great pledge vajra-fist is made.

original: dngos grub phyir zhes bya ba ni las kyi phyag rgya thams cad bcing ba rdzogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dngos grub phyir zhes bya ba ni las kyi phyag rgya thams cad bcing ba rdzogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of siddhi means for the sake of perfecting the binding of all karma-mudras.

original: rdo rje khu tshur rab tu brtag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur rab tu brtag / ces bya ba la /
translated: The vajra fist is fully imagined.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje thams cad la byin gyis brlabs pa dang / mdzad pa dang las kyi phyag rgya rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdo rje thams cad la byin gyis brlabs pa dang / mdzad pa dang las kyi phyag rgya rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to bless all mundane and supramundane vajras, and to accomplish the deeds and actions of the pledge seal,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rdo rje khu tshur gnyis po 'di brtag par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rdo rje khu tshur gnyis po 'di brtag par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: these two vajra fists of all buddhas and bodhisattvas are imagined.

original: dpal mchog dang bo'i rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: dpal mchog dang bo'i rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: The second section of the first chapter of the commentary on the glorious Supreme Original Buddha,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba las /
translated: called the “Arising of the Perfection of Wisdom,”

original: dum bu gnyis pa rtsa ba'i rgyud las /🔽dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyag rgya'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dum bu gnyis pa rtsa ba'i rgyud las / dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyag rgya'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: from the root tantra.🔽The explanation of the seals of the great maṇḍala of glorious Vajrasattva is complete.

original: // / de ltar rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the seals of the great maṇḍala of Vajrasattva,

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the characteristics of the maṇḍala mudrā of the Tathāgata,

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya'i rgyud kyi cho ga rgyas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽de nas kyi sgra ni skabs la babs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi phyag rgya'i rgyud kyi cho ga rgyas pa zhes bya ba gsungs te / de nas kyi sgra ni skabs la babs pa'o //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then, the extensive ritual of the mudrā tantra of the Tathāgata family.”

original: de bzhin @156a * //
analyzed: de bzhin @156a * //
translated: The word “then” [means] when the occasion has arrived.

original: gshegs ba dang / de'i rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: gshegs ba dang / de'i rigs ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs te /
translated: The Tathāgata and his family are the Tathāgata family.

original: de'i phyag rgya ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams te /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams te /
translated: His mudrā is the mudrās such as the great mudrā, etc.

original: de rnams kyi rgyud ni phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid ston pa'i sgra'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyud ni phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid ston pa'i sgra'i tshogs so //
translated: Their tantra is the collection of words that teach the characteristics of the mudrās.

original: de'i cho ga rgyas pa ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye bar gyur pa'i rgyun no //
analyzed: de'i cho ga rgyas pa ni phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye bar gyur pa'i rgyun no //
translated: Its extensive ritual is the continuity that is divided by the divisions of the great mudrā, etc.

original: phyag rgya chen po rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba bcings bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba bcings bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata of the great mudrās, etc., is the self that is to be bound.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du sems so sor rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs par bsams la /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du sems so sor rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rim pas bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs par bsams la /
translated: Just as it is, one should contemplate oneself as a Tathagata through the stages of discerning the mind and so forth.

original: ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta tishtha ham zhes bya bas nga rgyal bskyed la /
analyzed: ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta tishtha ham zhes bya bas nga rgyal bskyed la /
translated: With ya tha sarva tathagata tistha ham, one should generate pride.

original: de nas sa ma yo nya ham zhes bya bas dam tshig gi nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //🔽de nas rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas sa ma ya satva aa dhi tishtasva mam zhes bya bas byin gyis brlabs la rdo rje skyil mo krung bcings la /
analyzed: de nas sa ma yo nya ham zhes bya bas dam tshig gi nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o // de nas rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas sa ma ya satva aa dhi tishtasva mam zhes bya bas byin gyis brlabs la rdo rje skyil mo krung bcings la /
translated: Then, with samayo 'ham, one should generate the pride of commitment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcing bar bya ste /
translated: Then, with one's commitment seal, with samaya stva adhisthana mam, one should bless oneself, bind the vajra posture, and bind the two Tathagata fists.

original: khu tshur g-yon pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i dril bu dang bcas pa bsnyems par byas nas /
analyzed: khu tshur g-yon pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i dril bu dang bcas pa bsnyems par byas nas /
translated: One should make the left fist with the Tathagata bell, and with arrogance

original: g-yas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje blangs la gsor te /
analyzed: g-yas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje blangs la gsor te /
translated: take up the Tathagata vajra with the right hand and wave it.

original: aom dhi ta th'a ga to& ham zhes brjod cing rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul gyis gzung bar byas nas /
analyzed: aom dhi ta th'a ga to& ham zhes brjod cing rang gi snying gar bstod pa'i tshul gyis gzung bar byas nas /
translated: Saying Oṃ dhitathāgato 'ham, one should hold it to one's heart in the manner of praise.

original: 'di ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya chen po yin no //
translated: This is the great seal of Vairocana.

original: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po ni /
analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po ni /
translated: The great seals of Vajravetālī and so forth

original: ji ltar bris pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa las 'dir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bris pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa las 'dir shes par bya'o //
translated: should be understood here in accordance with the drawings.

original: dam tshig mchog ces bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams te /
analyzed: dam tshig mchog ces bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams te /
translated: The supreme commitments are the commitment seals.

original: de dag ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /🔽mthe bo mthe chung mnyam pa yi //🔽rdo rje sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar shes par bya zhe na / mthe bo mthe chung mnyam pa yi // rdo rje sna tshogs rdo rje'o //
translated: How should they be known?🔽The even-nailed🔽is the vajra-cross.

original: zhes bya ba la rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mthe bo gnyis kyi rtse mo zur du yang dag par sbyar ba byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mthe bo gnyis kyi rtse mo zur du yang dag par sbyar ba byas la /
translated: Having bound the vajra-bond, one should join the tips of the two thumbs together at an angle.

original: mthe chung gnyis kyis kyang rtse mo sbyar te dang po'i rdo rje'i tshul gyis dbus ma gnyis nang du bcug ste rtse mo sbyar te 'di ni dbus ma'i rtse mo can te /
analyzed: mthe chung gnyis kyis kyang rtse mo sbyar te dang po'i rdo rje'i tshul gyis dbus ma gnyis nang du bcug ste rtse mo sbyar te 'di ni dbus ma'i rtse mo can te /
translated: This is the “tip of the middle fingers,”

original: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: which is called the “vajra cross.”

original: 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: This is also a pledge seal of the transcendent lords.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: It is called the “vajra cross.”

original: mda' la sogs pa bcing ba ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mda' la sogs pa bcing ba ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The binding of the arrow and so forth is the same.🔽Just as in the secret mandala of Vajrasattva the arrow and bow and so forth arise from the first vajra of Vajra Weapon and so forth,

original: ji ltar rdo @156b rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa rnams kyi dang po'i rdo rje las byung ba'i mda' gzhu la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag🔽rgya las byung ba'i //
analyzed: ji ltar rdo @156b rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa rnams kyi dang po'i rdo rje las byung ba'i mda' gzhu la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya las byung ba'i //
translated: so here also the pledge seals of Vajra Weapon and so forth arise from the pledge seals of the transcendent lords.

original: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the pledge seals of Vajra Weapon and so forth.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This teaches the following.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa las byung ba'i dang po'i rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa las byung ba'i dang po'i rdo rje ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: The first vajra that arises from the vajra-binding is the pledge seal of the Bhagavat Vairochana.

original: 'di nyid / mthe ba mdzub rtse sbyar dbus ma'i rtse //
analyzed: 'di nyid / mthe ba mdzub rtse sbyar dbus ma'i rtse //
translated: This very [seal], with the tips of the thumb and forefinger in the center,

original: mig 'bras ltar byas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mig 'bras ltar byas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: is held like the eye.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje mtshon cha ma'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje mtshon cha ma'i'o //
translated: This is the vajra-weapon seal.

original: de nyid / dbus ma'i rdo rje 'og tu ni //
analyzed: de nyid / dbus ma'i rdo rje 'og tu ni //
translated: That very [seal], with the center vajra🔽pressed down with the thumb,

original: mthe bong gis mnan btsir bar bya //
analyzed: mthe bong gis mnan btsir bar bya //
translated: is pressed.

original: zhes bya ba ni k'i li k'i la'i'o //🔽rdo rje mtshon cha ma'i phyag rgya nyid rdo rje 'dren ma dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni k'i li k'i la'i'o // rdo rje mtshon cha ma'i phyag rgya nyid rdo rje 'dren ma dang 'dra bar /
translated: This is the kilikili seal.🔽The vajra-weapon seal itself, with the ring and little fingers spread apart,

original: srin lag mthe chung kha phye ba //
analyzed: srin lag mthe chung kha phye ba //
translated: like a vajra plow,

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dren ma'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje 'dren ma'i'o //
translated: is the vajra plow seal.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya nyid bskor nas pus mor gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje snyems ma'i'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya nyid bskor nas pus mor gzhag pa gang yin pa de ni rdo rje snyems ma'i'o //
translated: The very seal of the tathagata pledge, turning and placed on the knee, is the vajra-arrogance seal.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya nyid //
translated: The mudra of the Tathagata

original: gyen du gtor dang thur du blugs //
analyzed: gyen du gtor dang thur du blugs //
translated: is to pour upward and to pour downward.🔽Joining the thumbs, one should rotate,🔽stretch out, and apply;🔽rotating, one should place on the crown,

original: mthe bo sbyar nas bskor ba dang / rang tu brkyang zhing byug pa dang // bskor zhing spyi bor gnas pa dang // bskor zhing snying gar gzhag par bya //
analyzed: mthe bo sbyar nas bskor ba dang / rang tu brkyang zhing byug pa dang // bskor zhing spyi bor gnas pa dang // bskor zhing snying gar gzhag par bya //
translated: and rotating, one should place on the heart.🔽Fully rotating, one should laugh,

original: yongs su bskor zhing bzhad pa dang // kha las gyen du dbyung ba dang // de bzhin gar gyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bskor zhing bzhad pa dang // kha las gyen du dbyung ba dang // de bzhin gar gyis bskor ba'o //
translated: and likewise, one should rotate with dance.

original: mdzub mo'i sor mo gnyis kyis so //🔽g-yon pa'i mdzub mo g-yas kyis gzung //🔽mdzub mo mthe bo 'ching ba dang // mthe bo mtha' ma'i nang du gzhag / ces bya ba 'di rnams rim pa bzhin du dpyid ka rdo rje ma nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mdzub mo'i sor mo gnyis kyis so // g-yon pa'i mdzub mo g-yas kyis gzung // mdzub mo mthe bo 'ching ba dang // mthe bo mtha' ma'i nang du gzhag / ces bya ba 'di rnams rim pa bzhin du dpyid ka rdo rje ma nas brtsams te /
translated: With the two index fingers.🔽The left index finger should hold the right,🔽and the index finger should bind the thumb,🔽and the thumb should be placed in the middle.

original: rdo rje dril bu ma'i bar gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu ma'i bar gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams yin no //
translated: These are the pledge seals of Vasantavajra and so forth, up to Ghaṇṭavajra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi snying po rnams kho na 'dir chos kyi phyag rgya rnams yin no //🔽las kyi phyag rgya rnams ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams te /🔽rdo rje dril bu ma'i bar du las kyi phyag rgya rnams gang bar bstan pa de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil @157a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi snying po rnams kho na 'dir chos kyi phyag rgya rnams yin no // las kyi phyag rgya rnams ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje sems dpa' nas brtsams te / rdo rje dril bu ma'i bar du las kyi phyag rgya rnams gang bar bstan pa de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil @157a * //
translated: The Dharma-seals here are just the essence-mantras of the Tathagatas, etc.🔽The Action-seals are just those.🔽In the Vajrasattva maṇḍala, beginning with Vajrasattva and ending with Vajraghanta, the Action-seals are taught.

original: 'khor 'dir yang las kyi phyag rgya gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor 'dir yang las kyi phyag rgya gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Those very [Action-seals] should be taken as the Action-seals in this maṇḍala of the Tathāgatas.

original: khyad par ni 'di yin te 'dir khu tshur gnyis las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yin te 'dir khu tshur gnyis las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The difference is that here they arise from two fists.

original: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gyis de bzhin du bcing ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gyis de bzhin du bcing ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to teach just this, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Binding with the Tathāgata-fist just as before.🔽”

original: 'dis ni don 'di bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni don 'di bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This teaches the following meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings nas g-yon pa rdo rje snyems ma dang / g-yas pa rdo rje bstod pa'i tshul gyis snying gar bzung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings nas g-yon pa rdo rje snyems ma dang / g-yas pa rdo rje bstod pa'i tshul gyis snying gar bzung ste /
translated: Having formed the two Tathagata fists, holding the left one in a threatening gesture and the right one in the gesture of praise, hold them at the heart.

original: 'di ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi las kyi phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi las kyi phyag rgya yin no //
translated: This is the action seal of Vairocana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings nas sgeg pa dang bcas pas mtha' la sogs pa bkrol la klog 'gyu ba'i tshul gyis g-yas su yongs su bskor te spyi bo'i phyogs su ka pu ta'i thal mo kha sbyor bcings te phab nas rdo rje thal mo bcings
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings nas sgeg pa dang bcas pas mtha' la sogs pa bkrol la klog 'gyu ba'i tshul gyis g-yas su yongs su bskor te spyi bo'i phyogs su ka pu ta'i thal mo kha sbyor bcings te phab nas rdo rje thal mo bcings
translated: Having formed the two Tathagata fists, with flirtation release the corners and so on, and having turned to the right in the manner of a smile, form the joined palms of the kapotaka at the crown, and having lowered it, form the vajra palms.

original: la de nyid sgeg pas me tog 'bul ba'i tshul gyis te /
analyzed: la de nyid sgeg pas me tog 'bul ba'i tshul gyis te /
translated: With that, offer a flower in the manner of flirtation.

original: steng du gtor la slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings la /
analyzed: steng du gtor la slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings la /
translated: Having scattered it above, again form the two Tathagata fists.

original: mda' dang gzhu gtod pa'i tshul bya ste 'di ni rdo rje mtshon cha ma'i las kyi phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: mda' dang gzhu gtod pa'i tshul bya ste 'di ni rdo rje mtshon cha ma'i las kyi phyag rgya yin no //
translated: In the manner of aiming an arrow and bow, this is the action seal of Vajra Weapon.

original: de bzhin du gar byas nas rdo rje thal mo bcings la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gar byas nas rdo rje thal mo bcings la /
translated: Likewise, having danced, form the vajra añjali.

original: de nyid sgeg pas sbos 'bul ba'i tshul gyis 'og tu blugs la /
analyzed: de nyid sgeg pas sbos 'bul ba'i tshul gyis 'og tu blugs la /
translated: With that very gracefulness, offer incense in the manner of a lamp, and place it below.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings la bdag nyid 'khyud par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings la bdag nyid 'khyud par bya ste /

original: 'di ni rdo rje k'i li k'i la'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje k'i li k'i la'i'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings te rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba'i tshul gyis gzung bar bya ste /

original: 'di ni rdo rje dran ma'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje dran ma'i'o //

original: de bzhin du gar byas la rdo rje thal mo bcings te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gar byas la rdo rje thal mo bcings te /

analyzed: de nyid sgeg pas snying ga'i phyogs su brkyang la dris byug pa'i tshul gyis rab tu sbyar te /

analyzed: slar yang rdo rje thal mo bcings nas spyi bor bzung ste /

analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje snyems ma'i'o //

analyzed: @157b de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis snying ga'i phyogs su bskor zhing bcings te /

analyzed: me tog 'bul ba'i tshul gyis steng du gtor bar bya ste /
translated: Scatter them above in the manner of offering flowers.

original: 'di ni rdo rje dpyid ka ma'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje dpyid ka ma'i'o //

analyzed: spos 'bul ba'i tshul gyis 'og tu blugs par bya ste 'di ni rdo rje sprin ma'i'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bskor zhing bcings la /

analyzed: 'di ni ston ka rdo rje ma'i'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings nas bskor te snying ga'i phyogs su brkyang ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bskor nas snying ga'i phyogs su bcings nas gzung bar bya ste /

original: 'di ni sgeg mo'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sgeg mo'i'o //

translated: Likewise, make the two Tathagata fists and

original: 'di ni glu ma'i'o //
analyzed: 'di ni glu ma'i'o //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bskor zhing bcings la /
translated: Make the two Tathagata fists and

analyzed: gar gyi tshul gyis bskor bar bya ste 'di ni gar ma'i'o //
translated: rotate them as if dancing. This is the dancer's.

analyzed: gar dang bral ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings te /
translated: Make the two Tathagata fists without dancing and

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings te g-yas ba'i mdzub mo'i lcags kyus g-yon pa'i mdzub mo bspreng  ba gzung bar bya ste /

translated: The gesture of Vajra-Chain is made by binding the two Tathāgata fists and interlacing the index fingers and thumbs.

analyzed: g-yas pa'i mdzub mo'i lcags kyu ni rdo rje chen po gsang ba'i lcags kyu ma ste /

analyzed: 'dis aom badzra dha ri ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes mnyam pa nyid kyi gzungs brjod cing /

analyzed: da ni khu tshur gyi khyad par nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach just the differences of the fists,

analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur mthe bo gnyis la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: de gnyis su phye nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur ro zhes bya ba la 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig gi khu tshur de gnyis su byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis 'byung ba yin no
translated: Having made those two, the two tathāgata fists arise.

analyzed: // de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis dang / dkyil 'khor @158b lngas phyag btsal zhing 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gnyis bcings te /

translated: one should enter, bowing with the five natural maṇḍalas—the crown, the two palms, and the two knees—to the tathāgata maṇḍala, and singing the song of entering.

analyzed: 'di dag kyang dngos grub thams cad gsol pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, “all powers” are the five maṇḍalas.

translated: Just as the great seal, pledge seal, and doctrine seal taught in the Secret Mandala of Vajrasattva grant all powers,

translated: so too these great seal, pledge seal, doctrine seal, and action seal of the Tathagata mandala taught in the Tathagata mandala grant all powers of action.

analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyag rgya rnams bstan nas /

analyzed: rdo rje sku mchog gi zhes bya ba la / rdo rje bsdams pa 'og tu bcings nas /

analyzed: mthe bo gnyis brtan pa'i skyil mo krung gi tshul byas la /

analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis yang dag par sbyar nas /

analyzed: rtse mo'i tshul gyis gzung bar bya ste /

analyzed: 'di bcings la gar gyi tshul gyis yongs su bskor bar bya ste /

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

translated: If this supreme vajra body with the characteristics as explained is placed in the manner of a crown protrusion, it becomes the mudra of the crown protrusion.

original: bsrung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bsrung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: By this crown protrusion, all are protected.

original: 'di nyid yongs su bskor nas mdzub mo gnyis kyis mdzod sbu'i phyogs su 'dzin par byed nas mdzub mo gnyis kyis mdzod sbu'i phyogs su 'dzin par byed mchog de nyid snying ga'i phyogs su 'dzin na 'dis chos thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid yongs su bskor nas mdzub mo gnyis kyis mdzod sbu'i phyogs su 'dzin par byed nas mdzub mo gnyis kyis mdzod sbu'i phyogs su 'dzin par byed mchog de nyid snying ga'i phyogs su 'dzin na 'dis chos thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one holds the supreme mudra at the heart center, one will obtain all dharmas.

original: bskor zhing bskor bas mkhur chos dang / gtsug tor zhes bya ba la rdo rje sku mchog bcings nas gar gyi tshul gyis yongs su bskor bar bya ste /
analyzed: bskor zhing bskor bas mkhur chos dang / gtsug tor zhes bya ba la rdo rje sku mchog bcings nas gar gyi tshul gyis yongs su bskor bar bya ste /
translated: Circling the cheeks and the crown protrusion: Having bound the supreme vajra body, one should circle it in the manner of a dance.
