original: sngags ni chos kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: sngags ni chos kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i yi ge rnams so //
translated: The mantra is the syllables taught in the Dharma maṇḍala.

original: rigs pa ni las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po dang / chos dang las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyang snying po sngags dang phyag rgya dang / rig par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ni las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i phyag rgya chen po dang / chos dang las kyi phyag rgya rnams kyang snying po sngags dang phyag rgya dang / rig par brjod pa yin te /
translated: The reasoning is that the great seal, doctrine seal, and action seal, which are taught in the Action Tantra, are also called essence-mantra, seal, and knowledge.

original: snying po sngags dang phyag rgya dang / rig pa 'di rnams bsgrub pa 'di ni rjes su chags pa'i mtshan nyid can nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: snying po sngags dang phyag rgya dang / rig pa 'di rnams bsgrub pa 'di ni rjes su chags pa'i mtshan nyid can nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: These essence-mantras, seals, and knowledges are the means of achieving the near-essence, which is characterized by passion.

original: de nyid rmad du byung ba ni sngon ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rmad du byung ba ni sngon ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That very [near-essence] is marvelous because it is unprecedented.

original: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //🔽ci nus ci 'dod bzlas pa yi //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir // ci nus ci 'dod bzlas pa yi //
translated: In order to teach just that, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: nye ba'i snying po gsang ba'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po gsang ba'o //
translated: The near-essence is secret,🔽Recited as much as one can, as much as one wishes.

original: zhes bya ba la gang @173b zhig 'di ci nus pa dang / yid kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i bzlas pas gsang ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gang @173b zhig 'di ci nus pa dang / yid kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i bzlas pas gsang ba ste /
translated: Here, the secret is that which is recited as much as one can and as much as one wishes mentally.

original: rjes su chags pa'i dngos po nye ba'i snying po sgrub pa bstan pa de ni rmad du byung ba'i sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i dngos po nye ba'i snying po sgrub pa bstan pa de ni rmad du byung ba'i sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the means of achieving the near-essence, which is the object of passion, is the marvelous means of achievement.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don yod ces bya ba la don yod thogs med gsang ba ni phyag rgya rnams so ;
analyzed: don yod ces bya ba la don yod thogs med gsang ba ni phyag rgya rnams so ;
translated: The secret is the secret of that, which is the knowledge of the mantra.

original: / grub pa ni de dag grub pa'o //
analyzed: / grub pa ni de dag grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the accomplishment of that, which is the knowledge of the pledge.

original: ji ltar zhe na rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The nature is the nature of that, which is the knowledge of reality.

original: de bzhin du rjes su chags pa sgrub pa'i rnam pa des bsod nams dang mi ldan pa'i sgrub pa po sdig ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi yang phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi phyag rgya rnams dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su chags pa sgrub pa'i rnam pa des bsod nams dang mi ldan pa'i sgrub pa po sdig ba dang ldan pa rnams kyi yang phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi phyag rgya rnams dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur te
translated: In the same way, by that very form of accomplishing the passion, even for those practitioners who are not endowed with merit and are endowed with sin, all the seals of all the clans, such as the great seal, etc., will be accomplished.

original: / de'i phyir phyag rgya thams cad sgrub pa 'dis rmad du byung ba yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir phyag rgya thams cad sgrub pa 'dis rmad du byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this accomplishment of all the seals is marvelous.🔽 The supreme essence should not be given to those who have not entered the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa rnams la snying po mchog ni sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i snying po dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa rnams la sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa rnams la snying po mchog ni sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i snying po dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa rnams la sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: The essence of Vajrasattva, etc., should not be given to those who have not entered the maṇḍala.

original: gsang zhing gsang ba'i rgyud de ni //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsang zhing gsang ba'i rgyud de ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is the secret, secret tantra.🔽🔽

original: yang dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud 'di gsang zhing gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa rnams la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud 'di gsang zhing gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa rnams la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: In this way, this Tantra of the Supreme Original Buddha is not to be taught to those who have not entered the mandala of the Secret and the Secret.

original: gal te dngos grub yid 'ong 'dod ;
analyzed: gal te dngos grub yid 'ong 'dod ;
translated: If one desires the pleasant spiritual powers,🔽.

original: / ces bya ba la gal te slob dpon nges dpal mchog dang po'i dngos grub shin tu yid du 'ong ba 'dod na de'i tshe dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa rnams la sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: / ces bya ba la gal te slob dpon nges dpal mchog dang po'i dngos grub shin tu yid du 'ong ba 'dod na de'i tshe dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa rnams la sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: If the master desires the very pleasant spiritual powers of the Supreme Original Buddha, then at that time he should not give it to those who have not entered the mandala.

original: gang gi khyim du gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gi khyim du gnas gyur pa //
translated: In whose house it has been placed,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o /
translated: and so forth, is easy to understand.

original: // / de ltar dum bu gnyis pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud bstan nas //
analyzed: // / de ltar dum bu gnyis pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud bstan nas //
translated: Having thus taught the root Tantra of the second chapter,

original: da ni de nyid dang dum bu dang po las gsungs pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rtog pa thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de nyid dang dum bu dang po las gsungs pa'i rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rtog pa thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to include all the chapters of the root Tantra taught in the first chapter and in that very [second chapter],

original: sems can thams cad bde don du //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde don du //
translated: for the sake of the happiness of all sentient beings,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth is stated.

original: de la sems can thams cad kyi bde ba 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste de'i don du'o //
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad kyi bde ba 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste de'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings, for their mundane and supramundane happiness.

original: de bzhin du bstan pa thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' phan pa dang bde ba'i don du gnyer ba rnams kyi bya ba 'di yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan pa thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' phan pa dang bde ba'i don du gnyer ba rnams kyi bya ba 'di yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: And likewise, all the teachings are the work of those who seek the benefit and happiness of the Tathagata's word.

original: de grub pa ni gdul bya rnams kyis de'i rjes su 'brang bas te /
analyzed: de grub pa ni gdul bya rnams kyis de'i rjes su 'brang bas te /
translated: Its accomplishment is by the disciples who follow it.

original: de'i don du @174a * //
analyzed: de'i don du @174a * //
translated: For that purpose,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad de /
translated: all the atoms in all the world systems, all the Buddhas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' sras dang bcas pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' sras dang bcas pas /
translated: the Tathagatas, together with their Bodhisattva sons,

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje mchog 'dzin pa rdo rje 'chang chen po de la 'di skad ces zhus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje mchog 'dzin pa rdo rje 'chang chen po de la 'di skad ces zhus so //
translated: the Blessed One, the Holder of the Supreme Vajra, the Great Vajradhara, said this to him:

original: bde ba chen po rab grub phyir //
analyzed: bde ba chen po rab grub phyir //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing great bliss,

original: zhes bya ba ni gdul bya rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdul bya rnams kyis so //
translated: for the sake of the disciples.

original: chags pa chen po rnam dag phyir //
analyzed: chags pa chen po rnam dag phyir //
translated: For the sake of purifying great passion,

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid kyis so //
translated: This is so, according to them.

original: rtog pa thams cad bsdus pa'i rgyud //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad bsdus pa'i rgyud //
translated: The Tantra that includes all the concepts,

original: sems dpa' chen po bshad du gsol //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po bshad du gsol //
translated: the Great Hero, please explain.

original: zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rigs lnga'i rtog pa rnams bsdus pa ni rtog pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rigs lnga'i rtog pa rnams bsdus pa ni rtog pa thams cad bsdus pa ste /
translated: In the five concepts of Vajrasattva and so on, all the concepts are included, and that is the Tantra that includes all the concepts.

original: de dang der bstan pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa'i sgra thams cad kyi don gdul bya rnams kyis gzung ba'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang der bstan pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa'i sgra thams cad kyi don gdul bya rnams kyis gzung ba'i don zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of all the words such as concept and so on, taught in that and that, is the meaning that is grasped by the disciples.🔽The Tantra that teaches that, please speak the collection of words that teach the meaning by way of synonyms.

original: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud ni ming gi rnam grangs kyi sgo nas don ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs gsungs shig ces bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa sras dang bcas pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po la zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud ni ming gi rnam grangs kyi sgo nas don ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs gsungs shig ces bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa sras dang bcas pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po la zhus pa'o //
translated: The Tathagatas with their sons request the Bhagavat Great Vajradhara.

original: rnam rtog med pa'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i chos rnams la //
translated: In the non-conceptual Dharmas,

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning from here,

original: bdag cag rnams la bshad du gsol //
analyzed: bdag cag rnams la bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain to us.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mdor bstan pa'i gzhung gis zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mdor bstan pa'i gzhung gis zhus pa yin no //
translated: This is the request by the passage of brief indication.

original: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa la ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zhus pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa la ste de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis zhus pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: The word “then” is for immediately after, that is, immediately after the request of all the transcendent lords.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rtog pa rnams bsdus pa dris pa'i bka' grub pa bstan pa'i don yod par gzigs nas zhal shin tu rnam par bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rtog pa rnams bsdus pa dris pa'i bka' grub pa bstan pa'i don yod par gzigs nas zhal shin tu rnam par bzhad pa'o //
translated: Having seen that the purpose of the request is fulfilled, the purpose of the question being the vision of the accomplishment of the transcendent lords’ words for the sake of all sentient beings, he smiles a great smile.

original: dam tshig chen po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba rnam par gnon pa mdzad nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba rnam par gnon pa mdzad nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having made the declaration of the vajra of the reality of all great commitments,

original: dam tshig chen po yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na dam tshig chen po thams cad de /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na dam tshig chen po thams cad de /
translated: he, being a great commitment and all, is the great commitment of all.

original: rigs thams cad gnyis su med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs thams cad gnyis su med par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all clans as nondual is the reality of all commitments.

original: de kho na nyid kyis ni rigs lnga'i de kho na nyid bcu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyis ni rigs lnga'i de kho na nyid bcu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The reality of the five clans is the nature of the ten realities.

original: de nyid de bzhin nyid rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin nyid rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: That is a vajra because it is the suchness that is indivisible like a vajra.🔽The one who has that name is the one who emanates as the five families of conquerors and acts for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: @174b de'i ming can gyis rnam par gnon pa'i rigs lngar sbrul pas sems can gyi don mdzad nas 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'i rtog pa thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i rgyud phyi ma ste /
analyzed: @174b de'i ming can gyis rnam par gnon pa'i rigs lngar sbrul pas sems can gyi don mdzad nas 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'i rtog pa thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i rgyud phyi ma ste /
translated: The one who is thus is the one who knows all the concepts that abide in the mind just as they are.

original: mchog tu gyur pa'i sgra'i tshogs bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa'i sgra'i tshogs bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The one who is thus is the one who speaks the collection of supreme sounds, the Bhagavān Great Vajradhara.

original: de la phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rtog pa nges par shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de la phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rtog pa nges par shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of this, namely, that one will attain power by knowing the concepts of the great seal and so forth,

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rtog pa khyab pa'i rgyud 'di yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis dgar ba'am /
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rtog pa khyab pa'i rgyud 'di yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te / de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis dgar ba'am /
translated: it is said, “This is the pervading tantra of nonconceptual thought.”🔽In this regard, the word “this” is to be viewed as either a specification

original: ngag nye bar dgod pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngag nye bar dgod pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: or as a statement of proximity.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is as before.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni rtog pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni rtog pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Non-conceptuality is the concentration of non-conceptuality.

original: de las sngon goms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de las sngon goms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: From that, the conceptualization of the accomplishment of the mandala, etc. which arises by the power of previous cultivation is non-conceptual conceptualization.

original: de khyab pa ni gdul bya skye bo'i rgyud la sos sor gtad pa'i don du sgra'i tshogs ni 'dir khyab pa'i rgyud yin no //
analyzed: de khyab pa ni gdul bya skye bo'i rgyud la sos sor gtad pa'i don du sgra'i tshogs ni 'dir khyab pa'i rgyud yin no //
translated: Its pervasion is the pervasion continuum, which is the collection of words here for the purpose of directing the accomplishment into the continuum of the disciple.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa phral ba'i chos bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa phral ba'i chos bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The non-conceptual concentration of the realitylessness of the objective self, which is the separation of the conceptualizations of subject and object by the Tathāgatas,

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba ste rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid las so //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba ste rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin de nyid las so //
translated: The word “only” is a restriction, from that very non-conceptual concentration.

original: sems can don ni yongs su brtag / ces bya ba la phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub sems can rnams kyi don du gnyer bar byas na sems can gyi don no //
analyzed: sems can don ni yongs su brtag / ces bya ba la phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub sems can rnams kyi don du gnyer bar byas na sems can gyi don no //
translated: The benefit of sentient beings is fully investigated means that if one strives for the powers of the great seal, etc. for the benefit of sentient beings, it is the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don de yongs su ni phyogs bcu kun du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rab tu 'jug pas na yongs su brtag par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don de yongs su ni phyogs bcu kun du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rab tu 'jug pas na yongs su brtag par brjod pa yin no //
translated: That benefit of sentient beings is fully investigated because it is engaged in by the Blessed Buddhas in all ten directions.

original: yongs su brtag pa'i rgyud de'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa'i rgyud de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is called fully investigated.

original: des na rtog pa bshad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na rtog pa bshad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is explained as imagination.

original: rtog pa las byung ba'i rgyud de nyid kyi phyir phyag rgya chen po la sogs par ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rtog pa zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: rtog pa las byung ba'i rgyud de nyid kyi phyir phyag rgya chen po la sogs par ston par byed pa'i sgra'i tshogs ni rtog pa zhes bya ba ste //
translated: Because of just that tantra that arises from imagination, the collection of words that teach the great seal, etc. is called imagination.

original: de bshad pa ni brjod pa yin no //🔽rtog pa yongs su dag phyir ro //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni brjod pa yin no // rtog pa yongs su dag phyir ro //
translated: That is explained as expressed.🔽 Because of the purity of imagination.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdul bya rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gdul bya rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: etc. is for the sake of abandoning the concepts of those to be trained.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /🔽sangs @175a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te / sangs @175a * //
translated: This shows the following:

original: rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are always in equipoise.

original: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyi dbang gis bstan pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyi dbang gis bstan pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: They engage in teaching by the power of the momentum of their previous aspirations.

original: slar yang gdul bya rnams la ni /
analyzed: slar yang gdul bya rnams la ni /
translated: Again, with regard to disciples,

original: 'di ltar rtog pa 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa 'byung ba yin te /
translated: this idea occurs:

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam par rtog cing rnam par dpyad nas tshig tu gsung pa yin gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam par rtog cing rnam par dpyad nas tshig tu gsung pa yin gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med pas ni ma yin no //
translated: “The Blessed One speaks words after conceptualizing and analyzing, not without conceptualizing and analyzing.”

original: de ltar bstan pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i sgom pa po rnams rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtog pa'i phyir slob bzhin pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i sgom pa po rnams rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtog pa'i phyir slob bzhin pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: Thus, those who meditate on the great seal and so forth, as taught, are learners who conceptualize nonconceptualizing samādhi.

original: de bas rtog pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir rtog pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas rtog pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir rtog pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because conceptualization is purified, conceptualization is explained.

original: de ltar phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rtog pa shes pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rtog pa shes pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the knowledge of the concepts of the great seal, etc.,

original: da ni snying po'i rgyud shes pas dngos grub thob pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni snying po'i rgyud shes pas dngos grub thob pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that one attains power by knowing the essence tantra, not by other aspects,🔽he declares,

original: de la bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: therein, the great bliss, etc.

original: bde ba chen po rdo rje gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor ni /
analyzed: bde ba chen po rdo rje gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor ni /
translated: The great bliss secret vajra mandala

original: rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor yin la /
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor yin la /
translated: is the mandala of all the clans.

original: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud ni 'di yin te /
translated: The tantra which teaches that is this one.

original: sa la yi ge gnas bris nas /
analyzed: sa la yi ge gnas bris nas /
translated: Having written the syllables on the ground,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: in this regard,

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi la /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor gyis gzhi la /
translated: on the ground of the mandala which has the characteristics as explained,

original: kha dog dbyibs kyis bdag nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog dbyibs kyis bdag nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw the mandala which has the nature of color and shape.

original: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: yi ge'i gnas ni yi ge'i gnas te rten no //
analyzed: yi ge'i gnas ni yi ge'i gnas te rten no //
translated: The abode of the syllables is the support of the syllables.

original: 'gyur ba med pa chos kyi dbyings mngon du byed pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa chos kyi dbyings mngon du byed pa'i thabs so //
translated: It is the means of realizing the unchanging ultimate realm.

original: bde ba chen po zhes brjod do //🔽zhes bya ba la bde ba chen po thob par byed pa'i thabs dang / bde ba chen po'i rgyu dang mthun pa dang / bde ba chen po ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes brjod do // zhes bya ba la bde ba chen po thob par byed pa'i thabs dang / bde ba chen po'i rgyu dang mthun pa dang / bde ba chen po ston par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: is called the great bliss.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor de nyid bde ba chen po zhes bya bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor de nyid bde ba chen po zhes bya bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: In this verse, the mandala that has the nature of color and shape is called the great bliss, because it is the means of attaining the great bliss, because it is the cause of the great bliss, and because it is the revealer of the great bliss.

original: de'i dam tshig rdo rje zhes bya ba la gang zhig bde ba chen po'i snying po yi ge bcu bdun po nyid ni mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig rdo rje zhes bya ba la gang zhig bde ba chen po'i snying po yi ge bcu bdun po nyid ni mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pledge of that is the vajra, because the seventeen syllable essence of the great bliss is indivisible.

original: rdo rje de nyid rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor de'i dam tshig ni bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor de'i dam tshig ni bskyed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That vajra is the pledge of the mandala of all the clans, because it is the cause of its generation.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: snying po @175b thams cad sgrub par byed po'o zhes bya ba la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byang chub chen po'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de ni snying po ste /
analyzed: snying po @175b thams cad sgrub par byed po'o zhes bya ba la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byang chub chen po'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de ni snying po ste /
translated: The essence is the producer of all, because the essence is the non-conceptual intuition which has the character of great enlightenment.

original: de las byung ba'i yi ge bcu bdun gyi bdag nyid can nye bar btags pa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i yi ge bcu bdun gyi bdag nyid can nye bar btags pa'i snying po'o //
translated: The essence is the proximate essence, which is the nature of the seventeen syllables that arise from that.

original: de nyid 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: That is the universal accomplisher, because it is the perfection of all the mundane and supramundane maṇḍalas.

original: 'dis ni byang chub chen po'i mtshan nyid can du nges pa'i ye shes ni snying po'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub chen po'i mtshan nyid can du nges pa'i ye shes ni snying po'o //
translated: This is the essence, which is the gnosis of ascertainment that has the characteristic of great enlightenment.

original: de las byung ba'i sgra'i rang bzhin rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor rnams bskyed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de yang snying por bstan to //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sgra'i rang bzhin rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor rnams bskyed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de yang snying por bstan to //
translated: The cause that generates the maṇḍalas of all the families, which have the nature of sound, that arise from that is also taught to be the essence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa las sngon du thog ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gnas pa yin te de'i phyir yi ge bcu bdun pa'i snying po bar mtshams med pa nyid du rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor rnams skyed par
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa las sngon du thog ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gnas pa yin te de'i phyir yi ge bcu bdun pa'i snying po bar mtshams med pa nyid du rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor rnams skyed par
translated: The nondual gnosis, which is the nature of the beginningless beginning, abides prior to the good eon and so on. Therefore, the essence of the seventeen syllables generates the maṇḍalas of all the families without interruption.

original: byed pa nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: One abides in the very act of creation.

original: de ltar snying po shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar snying po shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas //
translated: Having thus taught the tantra of the knowledge of the essence,

original: da ni ji ltar sbrul pa'i dkyil 'khor shes pas dngos grub thob pa'i don du dkyil 'khor gyi bshad pa'i rgyud bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar sbrul pa'i dkyil 'khor shes pas dngos grub thob pa'i don du dkyil 'khor gyi bshad pa'i rgyud bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: now, in order to teach the tantra of the explanation of the maṇḍala for the purpose of attaining power through the knowledge of the emanated maṇḍala,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ji ltar gnas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog bsgoms pa'i dus su //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ji ltar gnas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog bsgoms pa'i dus su //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “there” and so forth. As for “just as it is situated,” at the time of meditating on the supreme maṇḍala victory,

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i gnas la sogs pa'i gnas bstan pa de bzhin du skyed mos tshal gyi gnas su dkyil 'khor gnas te rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i gnas la sogs pa'i gnas bstan pa de bzhin du skyed mos tshal gyi gnas su dkyil 'khor gnas te rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: just as the abode of the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Radiance and so forth are taught, in the same way, the maṇḍala is situated in the abode of the pleasure grove, and having been meditated on,

original: gnas de ru dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas de ru dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: the maṇḍala is drawn in that abode.

original: ji ltar dus zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar dus zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “just as the time,”

original: rgyas pa'i las ni snga dro //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i las ni snga dro //
translated: the activity of increase is in the morning,

original: drag po'i las ni nyi ma phyed dam mtshan phyed //
analyzed: drag po'i las ni nyi ma phyed dam mtshan phyed //
translated: the activity of violence is at noon or midnight,

original: zhi ba la ni srod kyi dus su'o //
analyzed: zhi ba la ni srod kyi dus su'o //
translated: and for pacification, it is at the time of dusk.

original: sgrub pa chen po la ni nyi ma 'char ka'i dus su dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po la ni nyi ma 'char ka'i dus su dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the great accomplishment, one should draw the mandala at the time of sunrise.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs su ni sgeg pa'i nyams gtso ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs su ni sgeg pa'i nyams gtso ba'o //
translated: As for just as in the world, in the glorious Vajrasattva family, the mood of grace is primary.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhi ba'i nyams gtso ba'o //🔽rdo rje h'um mdzad khro zhing rngam pa ste khro bo'i nyams gtso ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhi ba'i nyams gtso ba'o // rdo rje h'um mdzad khro zhing rngam pa ste khro bo'i nyams gtso ba'o //
translated: In the Tathagata family, the mood of peace is primary.🔽In Vajra Humkara, the mood of wrath is primary.

original: rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ni snying rje'i nyams gtso ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ni snying rje'i nyams gtso ba'o //
translated: In Vajradhatviśvarī, the mood of compassion is primary.

original: 'phags pa @176a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa @176a * //
translated: In Ārya

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid kyi rang bzhin dpa' ba'i nyams gtso ba ste dgyes shing dgyes pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid kyi rang bzhin dpa' ba'i nyams gtso ba ste dgyes shing dgyes pa yin no //
translated: Akāśagarbha, the mood of heroism is primary.

original: 'dir 'jig rten gyi sgras rigs brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten gyi sgras rigs brjod pa yin te /
translated: Here, the word world refers to the families.

original: 'jig rten de yang gang gi gang yin pa de nyid kyis de bri bar bya'o ;
analyzed: 'jig rten de yang gang gi gang yin pa de nyid kyis de bri bar bya'o ;
translated: And that world is of whatever kind, that is how one should draw it.

original: / ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni dbyibs la brten nas 'di gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: / ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni dbyibs la brten nas 'di gsungs pa yin te /
translated: As for just like, this is stated in dependence on shape.

original: 'jig rten de'i dbyibs ji lta bu yod pa de lta bu kho na dkyil 'khor du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten de'i dbyibs ji lta bu yod pa de lta bu kho na dkyil 'khor du bri bar bya'o //
translated: The maṇḍala should be drawn in just the shape of that world.

original: 'khor ni dgod par bya ba ste zhes bya ba la bri ba'i dkyil 'khor cho ga gong du lha rnams kyi gnas kyi nges pa bstan pa de bzhin du lha de bri bar bya ste gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor ni dgod par bya ba ste zhes bya ba la bri ba'i dkyil 'khor cho ga gong du lha rnams kyi gnas kyi nges pa bstan pa de bzhin du lha de bri bar bya ste gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The retinue should be arranged: the maṇḍala to be drawn is as previously explained in the section on the abode of the deities. The deities should be drawn in that way, not otherwise.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi don gyi rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi don gyi rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the tantra of the maṇḍala meaning,

original: da ni dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i phan yon shes pas kyang dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i phan yon shes pas kyang dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that siddhis will be accomplished by knowing the benefits of entering the maṇḍala,

original: dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the tantra of the ripening of entering the maṇḍala.

original: rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs na bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs gdul bya rnams la gang 'byung ba de ni rnam par smin pa zhes brjod de phan yon zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs na bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs gdul bya rnams la gang 'byung ba de ni rnam par smin pa zhes brjod de phan yon zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one enters the maṇḍala of all the clans, the accumulation of merit and knowledge that occurs for the disciples is called “maturation,” which is the meaning of “benefit.”

original: rdo rje sems dpa' sogs sems dpa'i //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' sogs sems dpa'i // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The heroes Vajrasattva, etc.,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: The heroes Vajrasattva, etc., are those who have Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje yid las byung ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rdo rje yid las byung ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with Vajramanas,

original: rin chen dril bu'i mthar thug pa'i rigs lnga'i lha rnams so //🔽de rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pa de tshe dkyil 'khor du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rin chen dril bu'i mthar thug pa'i rigs lnga'i lha rnams so // de rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pa de tshe dkyil 'khor du zhes bya ba la /
translated: up to Ratnaghantā, they are the deities of the five clans.🔽Their retinue, at that time, in the maṇḍala,

original: 'khor dang lhan cig tu zhugs pas na 'khor dang bcas pa ste rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor dang lhan cig tu zhugs pas na 'khor dang bcas pa ste rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: means that they enter together with the retinue, and so they are “with retinue,” such as the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva, etc.

original: chos kyi longs spyod kyi phyir sprul pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor der de tshe ste de'i dus su ji ltar skal ba dang ldan pa rnams bzhugs pas /
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod kyi phyir sprul pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor der de tshe ste de'i dus su ji ltar skal ba dang ldan pa rnams bzhugs pas /
translated: For the sake of enjoying the Dharma, the mandala with its emanated retinue is there at that time, at that occasion, just as the fortunate ones are present.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ji tsam 'byung ba'i tshad de tsam dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi bri ba'i dkyil 'khor 'dir de ltar zhugs kyang 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ji tsam 'byung ba'i tshad de tsam dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi bri ba'i dkyil 'khor 'dir de ltar zhugs kyang 'byung ba yin no //
translated: In this drawn mandala, just as much merit will arise as arises for them.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gdul bya'i @176b skye bo rnams spros par bya ba'i phyir bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gdul bya'i @176b skye bo rnams spros par bya ba'i phyir bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the result of entering the mandala for the sake of guiding disciples,

original: da ni rigs thams cad kyi 'khor lo'i khyad par shes pas kyang dngos grub 'byung ba yin no zhes rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rigs thams cad kyi 'khor lo'i khyad par shes pas kyang dngos grub 'byung ba yin no zhes rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that siddhis will also arise through knowing the distinctions of the cakras of all the families,

original: de nas rigs thams cad 'khor lo'i rgyud ces bya ba rigs thams cad kyi 'khor lo'i khyad par shes pa'i rgyud gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas rigs thams cad 'khor lo'i rgyud ces bya ba rigs thams cad kyi 'khor lo'i khyad par shes pa'i rgyud gsungs pa yin te /
translated: the tantra called the Tantra of the Wheel of All the Families, the tantra that is the knowledge of the distinctions of the cakras of all the families, is taught.

original: rigs thams cad kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The maṇḍala of all the families.

original: de rnams kyi khyad par ni gsal ba'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi khyad par ni gsal ba'i dbye ba'o //
translated: Their distinction is the division of the clear.

original: rdo rje 'khor lo bstan pa bzhin //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo bstan pa bzhin //
translated: As the vajra wheel is taught.

original: zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi dkyil 'khor ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi dkyil 'khor ni /
translated: In this, the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva and the Tathāgatas

original: rdo rje 'khor lo ste sngar bri ba'i cho gar gnyis po'i kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo ste sngar bri ba'i cho gar gnyis po'i kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du gzung bar bya'o //
translated: is the vajra wheel. As the color and form of the two were explained in the ritual of drawing previously, so should it be grasped.

original: lcags kyi 'khor lo dam pa ste //
analyzed: lcags kyi 'khor lo dam pa ste //
translated: The excellent iron wheel.

original: zhes bya ba la dkyil 'khor dam pa ni phul du byung ba ste nang gi dkyil 'khor ni lcags kyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dkyil 'khor dam pa ni phul du byung ba ste nang gi dkyil 'khor ni lcags kyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: The excellent maṇḍala is the supreme one. The inner maṇḍala should be drawn with iron.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'bar ba'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje khro bo'i nang gi rim pa gang yin pa de 'bar ba'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba'i rdo rje khro bo'i nang gi rim pa gang yin pa de 'bar ba'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: The blazing wheel. The inner circle of the blazing vajra wrathful one is the blazing wheel.

original: lcags kyi yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lcags kyi yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is of iron, is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du padma 'dab brgyad ces bya ba la ji ltar sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid de nyid kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin du padma 'dab brgyad ces bya ba la ji ltar sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis rdo rje sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dag gi dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid de nyid kyis /
translated: Likewise, the eight-petaled lotus is the inner maṇḍala of Vajraratnasambhava, which has the characteristics as previously explained, and is taught as the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva and the tathāgatas.

original: rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug gi nang gi dkyil 'khor padma 'dab ma brgyad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug gi nang gi dkyil 'khor padma 'dab ma brgyad par shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, by means of those characteristics, one should know the inner maṇḍala of Vajrarāga to be an eight-petaled lotus.

original: nor bu che zhes bya ba 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i nang gi dkyil 'khor zur brgyad pa'i nor bu chen po'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nor bu che zhes bya ba 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'i nang gi dkyil 'khor zur brgyad pa'i nor bu chen po'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The great jewel is the inner maṇḍala of Ākāśagarbha, which should be known to be the nature of a great jewel with eight corners.

original: de ltar 'khor lo'i khyad par shes pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo'i khyad par shes pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the knowledge of the differences of the wheels,

original: da ni dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi sgrub pa shes pas dngos grub 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi sgrub pa shes pas dngos grub 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that the arising of the powers is by means of the knowledge of the practice of all maṇḍalas,

original: de nas dkyil 'khor thams cad sgrub pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor thams cad sgrub pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, the tantra called the Practice of All Maṇḍalas.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad ni ji ltar bshad pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad ni ji ltar bshad pa bzhin te /
translated: All mandalas are as explained.

original: de rnams sgrub pa ni rdzogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de rnams sgrub pa ni rdzogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Their accomplishment is the cause of perfection.

original: dkyil 'khor brtag par byas nas ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor brtag par byas nas ni //
translated: Having constructed the mandala,

original: zhes bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor bris te yang dag par @177a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor bris te yang dag par @177a * //
translated: having drawn the mandala just as it is explained, one should make perfect offerings.

original: mchod la / nang gi rim pas 'jug bya ste //
analyzed: mchod la / nang gi rim pas 'jug bya ste //
translated: One should enter by the inner sequence.

original: zhes bya ba la 'jug pa'i tshogs dkyil 'khor du zhugs nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'jug pa'i tshogs dkyil 'khor du zhugs nas /
translated: Having entered the mandala assembly,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid chen po ste gtso bo la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid chen po ste gtso bo la /
translated: one should say to the great lord of the mandala,

original: dza: h'um bam ho:/
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho:/
translated: JAH HUM BAM HOH,

original: pra siddhya mam zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pra siddhya mam zhes bya ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: PRASIDHYA MAM.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the tantra of mandala accomplishment,

original: da ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid shes pas kyang de bsgrub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid shes pas kyang de bsgrub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that one should accomplish that by knowing Vajrasattva himself,

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa' nyid bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te rdo rje sems dpa' dngos po ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid do //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpa' nyid bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te rdo rje sems dpa' dngos po ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid do //
translated: he declares the tantra called the explanation of Vajrasattva-ness. The entity of Vajrasattva is Vajrasattva-ness.

original: de'i bshad pa'i rgyud 'di yin te ;
analyzed: de'i bshad pa'i rgyud 'di yin te ;
translated: This is the explanatory tantra:

original: sangs rgyas la sogs sems can kun //🔽zhes bya ba la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems can thams cad kyi dang por sangs rgyas gang la yod pa de ni sangs rgyas la sogs sems can kun te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs sems can kun // zhes bya ba la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems can thams cad kyi dang por sangs rgyas gang la yod pa de ni sangs rgyas la sogs sems can kun te /
translated: All sentient beings, such as the Buddha,🔽In this, all sentient beings, such as the Buddha, are those who have the Buddha at the beginning.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sems can thams cad do //
translated: All sentient beings, such as the Buddha, are all sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyi thams cad nyid ni thams cad kyi sems kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi thams cad nyid ni thams cad kyi sems kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: All of them is the nature of the mind of all.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen yin la /
translated: The Bhagavān is Great Vajradhara.

original: thog ma tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin can bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin can bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: The Bhagavān Great Vajradhara has the nature of the beginningless and endless dharmadhātu.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni phul du byung ba ste /
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni phul du byung ba ste /
translated: Supreme means excellent.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i sems can ni don dam par thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i sems can ni don dam par thog ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that sentient beings, such as the ālaya consciousness, are ultimately unborn from the beginning.

original: sems can 'byung phyir sems dpa' ste //
analyzed: sems can 'byung phyir sems dpa' ste //
translated: Because of the arising of sentient beings, there is the heroic being.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The hero is for the sake of the appearance of sentient beings.

original: thog ma tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po de la rigs lnga'i rang bzhin gyi sems can rnams sngon goms pa'i stobs kyis /
analyzed: thog ma tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po de la rigs lnga'i rang bzhin gyi sems can rnams sngon goms pa'i stobs kyis /
translated: In this regard, the Bhagavān, the Great Vajradhara, who is the essence of the beginningless and endless dharmadhātu, by the power of previous habituation,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'byung ba yin te de'i phyir nye bar btags nas sems dpa' zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'byung ba yin te de'i phyir nye bar btags nas sems dpa' zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: appears for the sake of fulfilling the wishes of all sentient beings who have the nature of the five families. Therefore, he is figuratively called a “hero.”

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni mi phyed pa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is indivisible.

original: rab tu grags pa ni rdo rje 'chang gis rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa ni rdo rje 'chang gis rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Well known is taught by Vajradhara.

original: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa' bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa' bshad nas /
translated: Having explained Vajrasattva in this way,

original: da ni dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid shes na dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid shes na dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that if one knows the reality of the great pledge, one will attain power,

original: dam @177b tshig chen po'i de kho na'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dam @177b tshig chen po'i de kho na'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares the tantra called the Reality of the Great Pledge.

original: dam tshig kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas dam tshig chen po ste /🔽thog ma tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam tshig kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas dam tshig chen po ste / thog ma tha ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: It is a commitment and it is great, thus it is a great commitment.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i de nyid yin no //
translated: It is the reality of Great Vajradhara because it pervades all of the nature of the basic element of reality, which is without beginning or end.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni rab tu dga' ba'i kun du bzang po nyid do //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni rab tu dga' ba'i kun du bzang po nyid do //
translated: Its reality is the very nature of Samantabhadra, who is the Joyful-One.

original: thog ma tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma tha ma med pa'o //
translated: It is without beginning or end.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: And so on.

original: khams gsum pa'i chos nyid dang / khams gsum la sprul pa mthong bas 'khor ba'o /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i chos nyid dang / khams gsum la sprul pa mthong bas 'khor ba'o /
translated: The reality of the three realms and the emanations seen in the three realms are samsara.

original: de bzhin mya ngan 'das zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin mya ngan 'das zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa ste /
translated: The reality of the nirvana of the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Tathagatas is the ultimate because it is the very nature of nirvana.

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is nirvana.

original: de ltar dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid kyi bshad pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dam tshig chen po'i de kho na nyid kyi bshad pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the tantra of the explanation of the reality of the great commitment,🔽now, in order to teach the tantra of the explanation of the reality of the great pledge, he says:

original: da ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that one attains power through knowledge of the absence of beginning and end,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares the Tantra of the Explanation of the Absence of Beginning and End.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dngos po ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid de /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dngos po ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid de /
translated: The absence of beginning and end is the absence of beginning and end.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid ni dang po nas ma skyes pa'i 'dus byas thams cad do //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid ni dang po nas ma skyes pa'i 'dus byas thams cad do //
translated: The absence of beginning and end is all conditioned things that are not produced from the beginning.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ba ni /
translated: That itself is to be explained.

original: nam mkha' 'byung ba chen po'i gnas //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'byung ba chen po'i gnas // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The abode of the great element of space.

original: nam mkha'i skye ba zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la sogs pa zhig pas nam mkha' skye ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i skye ba zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la sogs pa zhig pas nam mkha' skye ba ste /
translated: The so-called production of space is the production of space through the destruction of walls, etc.

original: rdzas thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rdzas thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It is characterized by the absence of all substances.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽skye med phyir zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / skye med phyir zhes bya ba la //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because of non-production.

original: skye ba med pa ni skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Non-production is the absence of production.

original: rgyu de'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa zhig pa nyid nam mkha'i skye ba ste nam mkha'i rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa zhig pa nyid nam mkha'i skye ba ste nam mkha'i rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that reason, the destruction of a wall, etc. is the arising of space, because it is not the substance of space.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is just so with Vajrasattva.

original: ji ltar rtsig pa la sogs pa rnam par zhig pa ni nam mkha' skye bar 'dogs pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba las ma byung ba'i kun du brtags pa 'jig pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' skye zhes 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rtsig pa la sogs pa rnam par zhig pa ni nam mkha' skye bar 'dogs pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba las ma byung ba'i kun du brtags pa 'jig pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' skye zhes 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Just as the destruction of a wall, etc. is designated as the arising of space, so the destruction of the imagined, which does not arise from the yogi, is designated as the arising of Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid bstan nas da ni rab tu dga' ba nyid shes pas kyang dngos grub thob bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu @178a * //
analyzed: de ltar thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid bstan nas da ni rab tu dga' ba nyid shes pas kyang dngos grub thob bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu @178a * //
translated: Having thus taught the absence of beginning and end, now, in order to teach that even by knowing the state of supreme joy, one attains power,

original: dga' ba nyid kyi bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: dga' ba nyid kyi bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: then the Lord spoke the Tantra of the Explanation of the State of Supreme Joy, which has the nature of non-abiding nirvana.

original: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa las kyang sngar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa las kyang sngar gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: And in the Bhadrakalpita and so on, it is said that the yogi/ni of the past,

original: rdo rje lha mo tshogs kyi nang du bde ba dang yid bde ba thams cad nyams su myong zhing zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ni rab tu dga' ba ste de'i dngos po ni rab tu dga' ba nyid do //🔽rab tu dga' phyir nyon mongs te //
analyzed: rdo rje lha mo tshogs kyi nang du bde ba dang yid bde ba thams cad nyams su myong zhing zhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ni rab tu dga' ba ste de'i dngos po ni rab tu dga' ba nyid do // rab tu dga' phyir nyon mongs te //
translated: the Bhagavan Vajrasattva, having experienced all the bliss and mental bliss in the midst of the assembly of Vajra goddesses, is the Joyful One, and his state is Joyfulness.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of great joy, there is passion.

original: bud med dang skyes pa dag gi dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i khyad par ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dag gi dbang po gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i khyad par ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The special bliss and mental bliss that arises from the union of the two organs of woman and man is the Joyful One.

original: de'i don du 'gro ba thams cad ste chags pa dang bcas pa'i sems can gyi khams nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i don du 'gro ba thams cad ste chags pa dang bcas pa'i sems can gyi khams nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For that reason, all beings, the realm of passionate sentient beings, become passionate.

original: de khyad par ci dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ci dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the special quality of that?

original: bde ba 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The desire for bliss

original: 'gro ba de dag thams cad bde ba 'dod pas tshol khro'i sdug bsngal gyis nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba de dag thams cad bde ba 'dod pas tshol khro'i sdug bsngal gyis nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: All those beings are afflicted by the suffering of searching, because they seek happiness.

original: de la zhes bya ba'i ni 'gro ba der ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i ni 'gro ba der ro //
translated: There means in that world.

original: bde ba rnam dag phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba rnam par dag pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bde ba rnam dag phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba rnam par dag pa'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of pure happiness means for the sake of the purification of happiness.

original: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa las snga rol du lha mo'i tshogs kyi nang na zhugs pa thogs ma dang tha ma med pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' skye ba yin te /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa las snga rol du lha mo'i tshogs kyi nang na zhugs pa thogs ma dang tha ma med pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' skye ba yin te /
translated: Prior to the Bhadrakalpa and so forth, Vajrasattva, the transcendent lord without beginning or end, took birth among the hosts of goddesses.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug la sogs pa 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug gi gzugs su skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug la sogs pa 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug gi gzugs su skye ba yin no //
translated: In order to tame the lords of the desire realm and so forth, he took birth in the form of Vajra-Kamadeva.

original: de nas de'i gzugs mthong nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug ye shes 'bab pa mthong nas sa brgyad dbang phyug tu grub ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i gzugs mthong nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug ye shes 'bab pa mthong nas sa brgyad dbang phyug tu grub ste /
translated: Then, seeing his form, the lords of the desire realm saw the descent of wisdom and attained mastery of the eighth stage.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug thob par 'dod pa gzhan dag kyang 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug thob par 'dod pa gzhan dag kyang 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān, in order to tame others who desire to attain the lordship of the desire realm,

original: rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gi gzugs su phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du 'khor bar bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dod pa'i dbang phyug gi gzugs su phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du 'khor bar bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: remains in cyclic existence until the end of time in the form of Vajra Lord of Desire.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu dga' ba nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rab tu dga' ba nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān having taught the state of supreme joy,

original: da ni snying po'i de kho na nyid shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni snying po'i de kho na nyid shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach that one will attain power by knowing the reality of the essence,

original: de nas dang po'i snying po de kho na nyid bshad pa'i rgyud ces @178b bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas dang po'i snying po de kho na nyid bshad pa'i rgyud ces @178b bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares, “Then, the Tantra of the Explanation of the Reality of the First Essence.”

original: dang po yang yin la snying po yang yin pas dang po'i snying po ste yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: dang po yang yin la snying po yang yin pas dang po'i snying po ste yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: Since it is first and it is an essence, it is the first essence, the syllable hūṃ.

original: de'i de kho na nyid ni 'dod pa can thams cad sad par byed pa'i las so //
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid ni 'dod pa can thams cad sad par byed pa'i las so //
translated: Its reality is the function of arousing all passionate ones.

original: chags pa kun nas chags pa che //
analyzed: chags pa kun nas chags pa che //
translated: Passionate, greatly passionate,

original: zhes bya ba la chags pa yang yin la kun kyang yin pas chags pa kun te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la chags pa yang yin la kun kyang yin pas chags pa kun te /
translated: And since it is also passion and it is all, it is the passion of all.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid do //🔽chags pa kun de nyid las chags pa che ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin nyid do // chags pa kun de nyid las chags pa che ba ste /
translated: It is the nature of the method and wisdom of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: snying po 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: snying po 'byung ba yin no //
translated: From that passion of all, there is the great passion, which is the source of the essence.

original: de las ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de las ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'dod ldan thams cad sad par byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod ldan thams cad sad par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: It awakens all who are passionate.

original: dngos grub thams cad 'dod pa ni 'dod ldan thams cad do //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad 'dod pa ni 'dod ldan thams cad do //
translated: All who are passionate are those who desire all powers.

original: de sad pa ni rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de sad pa ni rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Awakening them is making them manifest.

original: chags pa 'bar ba dri za'i snying po zhes bya ba la chags pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: chags pa 'bar ba dri za'i snying po zhes bya ba la chags pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: The essence of the gandharva of the blazing passion is the passion, which is Vajrasattva.

original: chags pa dam tshig rab tu bshad //
analyzed: chags pa dam tshig rab tu bshad //
translated: Passion is taught as the pledge.

original: ces 'og nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces 'og nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it will be said below.

original: de 'bar ba ni sgrub pa po'i rgyud la mngon du 'gyur bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de 'bar ba ni sgrub pa po'i rgyud la mngon du 'gyur bar byed pa ste /
translated: Blazing is making it manifest in the continuum of the practitioner.

original: de'i don du dri za'i snying po ni glu'i snying po ste yi ge h'um yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i don du dri za'i snying po ni glu'i snying po ste yi ge h'um yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of that is: the essence of gandharva is the essence of song, which is the syllable hūṃ.

original: de gang gi snying po yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gi snying po yin zhe na /
translated: Whose essence is that?

original: phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ste rdo rje 'chang gi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ste rdo rje 'chang gi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Of Vajrapāṇi, which means of Vajradhara.

original: da ni yi ge h'um gi glu blang ba shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de nas yi ge h'um gi glu blang ba'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni yi ge h'um gi glu blang ba shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de nas yi ge h'um gi glu blang ba'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach that one will attain power by knowing the song of the syllable hūṃ, [the Bhagavān] declares, then the tantra called the Song of the Syllable Hūṃ.

original: yi ge h'um nyid glu ste yi ge h'um gi glu'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um nyid glu ste yi ge h'um gi glu'o //
translated: The song of the syllable hūṃ is the song of the syllable hūṃ.

original: de'i glu blang ba ni drug ldan la sogs pa'i glu rnam pa thams cad kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i glu blang ba ni drug ldan la sogs pa'i glu rnam pa thams cad kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir bzlas pa'o //
translated: The singing of that is the repetition by all the modes of singing, such as the six-fold, for the sake of accomplishing the desired aim.

original: glu las chags pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge h'um dang bcas pa'i glu'i bzlas pa las rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i yul la chags pa ni zhen pa'o //
analyzed: glu las chags pa zhes bya ba ni yi ge h'um dang bcas pa'i glu'i bzlas pa las rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i yul la chags pa ni zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment from the song is the attachment, the clinging, to the object of Vajrasattva, etc., from the repetition of the song with the syllable hūṃ.

original: zhen pa de las dga' ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhen pa de las dga' ba skye ba'o //
translated: From that attachment, joy arises.

original: dga' ba las 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba las 'dod pa ste /
translated: From joy, desire arises.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang yid bde ba ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang yid bde ba ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is the bliss and mental bliss that arises from the meditation on Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: rab tu dga' bas thams cad 'byung //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bas thams cad 'byung //
translated: From the highest joy, everything arises.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi rab tu dga' ba de las @179a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i bsgom pa las byung ba'i bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi rab tu dga' ba de las @179a * //
translated: The highest joy, which is the nature of the bliss and mental bliss that arises from the meditation on Vajrasattva and so forth,

original: rigs thams cad 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs thams cad 'byung ba yin no //
translated: from that, all the families arise.

original: thams cad 'byung bar grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: thams cad 'byung bar grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because everything arises,

original: bskal pa'i dang por bcom ldan gsungs //
analyzed: bskal pa'i dang por bcom ldan gsungs //
translated: it was taught by the Bhagavān at the beginning of the eon.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: rigs thams cad 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: rigs thams cad 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
translated: the arising of all families is birth.

original: de grub pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de grub pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Its accomplishment is the completion in the mindstream of the disciple.

original: de'i don du bskal pa bzang po'i dang por bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos yi ge h'um gi zhes bya ba'i snying po gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du bskal pa bzang po'i dang por bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos yi ge h'um gi zhes bya ba'i snying po gsungs pa yin no //
translated: For that purpose, at the beginning of the fortunate eon, the Bhagavān Mahāvajradhara taught the essence of the syllable hūṃ.

original: de ltar yi ge h'um gi glu blang ba'i rgyud bstan nas /🔽da ni yi ge h'um gi glu'i bzlas pa'i don shes pas dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yi ge h'um gi glu blang ba'i rgyud bstan nas / da ni yi ge h'um gi glu'i bzlas pa'i don shes pas dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having explained the tantra of the song of the syllable hūṃ,🔽now, in order to explain that one attains power by knowing the meaning of the recitation of the song of the syllable hūṃ,

original: de nas yi ge h'um gi bzlas pa'i don gyi bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas yi ge h'um gi bzlas pa'i don gyi bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, the tantra called the explanation of the meaning of the recitation of the syllable hūṃ.

original: yi ge h'um gi bzlas pa'i don ni rjes su chags pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge h'um gi bzlas pa'i don ni rjes su chags pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the recitation of the syllable hūṃ is passion.

original: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i rgyud bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān has spoken the tantra that teaches that.

original: myur du thams cad rjes chags pas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: myur du thams cad rjes chags pas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: By quickly pleasing all,

original: thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ste /
translated: all means Vajrasattva and so on.

original: de rjes su chags pa ni yang dang yang du mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rjes su chags pa ni yang dang yang du mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: Pleasing them is their repeated manifestation.

original: thams cad rjes su chags pa de las myur du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad rjes su chags pa ni sgrub pa po'i mngon du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rjes su chags pa de las myur du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad rjes su chags pa ni sgrub pa po'i mngon du gyur pa yin no //
translated: From that, the quick pleasing of all, the power of Vajrasattva and so on, is the manifestation of the adept.

original: rjes su chags par byed mchog ni //
analyzed: rjes su chags par byed mchog ni //
translated: The supreme means of pleasing

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽ji ltar bzhugs pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku yang dang yang du rjes su chags par byed pa ni bdag gi mngon sum du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mchog ni phul du byung
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / ji ltar bzhugs pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku yang dang yang du rjes su chags par byed pa ni bdag gi mngon sum du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mchog ni phul du byung
translated: Thus,🔽the supreme, the best,

original: ba ste snying po'i yi ge h'um bzlas pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: ba ste snying po'i yi ge h'um bzlas pa'i don yin no //
translated: is the meaning of the recitation of the essence syllable hūṃ.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste snying po'i bzlas pa'i don 'di nyid mchog tu gyur pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de ltar yi ge h'um gi glu'i bzlas pa'i don bstan nas da ni rdo rje sems dpar shes pas dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste snying po'i bzlas pa'i don 'di nyid mchog tu gyur pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de ltar yi ge h'um gi glu'i bzlas pa'i don bstan nas da ni rdo rje sems dpar shes pas dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The word ni is a restrictive particle, and has the meaning that just this is the supreme meaning of the recitation of the essence, and not another.🔽Thus, having taught the meaning of the song recitation of the syllable hūṃ, now, in order to teach that one obtains power by knowing Vajrasattva,

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpar byung ba'i bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te glu rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpar byung ba'i bshad pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te glu rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he declares the explanatory tantra called the Vajrasattva Arising,🔽the songs, etc.

original: ji ltar glu rnams khro bo'i rnam pa can gyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mthu las rdo rje thog rdzogs pa'i blos //🔽rdo rje @179b thog bstan par gyur pa 'bebs pa de bzhin du rdo rje bsdus pa'o zhes bya ba la chos bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i spyod pa'i sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bos de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ye shes lnga'i
analyzed: ji ltar glu rnams khro bo'i rnam pa can gyi sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mthu las rdo rje thog rdzogs pa'i blos // rdo rje @179b thog bstan par gyur pa 'bebs pa de bzhin du rdo rje bsdus pa'o zhes bya ba la chos bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i spyod pa'i sems rtse gcig pa'i ngo bos de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ye shes lnga'i
translated: Just as the songs, by the power of the one-pointed mind in the form of the wrathful ones,

original: rtse mo mi phyed pa can gyi sems bsdus par brtag par ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtse mo mi phyed pa can gyi sems bsdus par brtag par ni rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: cause the vajra lightning to fall, in the same way, the vajra gathering, in the vajra gathering, one should imagine the vajra mind, the vajra mind, as Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar sems rdo rje nyid du bstan nas da ni rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sems rdo rje nyid du bstan nas da ni rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba shes pas dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the vajra mind, now, in order to teach that one will attain power by knowing the origin of Vajrasattva,

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he declares, then the tantra called the knowledge of the origin of Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba ni skye ba ste /
translated: The arising of Vajrasattva is the birth.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la shes pa gang las 'byung ba de ni rdo rje sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la shes pa gang las 'byung ba de ni rdo rje sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness from which it arises in the continuum of the yogi is the consciousness of the arising of Vajrasattva.

original: sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The being is Vajrasattva.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word ni means “because.”

original: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba la thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams te /
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba la thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams te /
translated: “The nature of all” means all sentient beings such as the Tathagatas.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid de thams cad sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽bdag gi bdag nyid la yang gnas //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid de thams cad sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to // bdag gi bdag nyid la yang gnas //
translated: Their nature is the nature of all, meaning that all are of the nature of mind and mental factors.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It also abides in the nature of the self.
