original: bdag gi sems dang sems las byung ba la yang de'i bdag nyid rjes su zhugs te tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi sems dang sems las byung ba la yang de'i bdag nyid rjes su zhugs te tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: In the mind and mental factors of the self, that nature is present, abiding in the nature of the beginningless and endless Dharma, in an undifferentiated manner.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dngos su 'dir //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dngos su 'dir //
translated: Vajrasattva is actually present here.

original: zhes bya ba la dngos su lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs kyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rnal 'byor pa 'di la bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dngos su lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs kyis rdo rje dang dril bu 'dzin pa'i bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' rnal 'byor pa 'di la bzhugs pa ste /
translated: Here, the Bhagavān Vajrasattva, holding the vajra and bell, is actually present through the power of superior intention for this yogin.

original: gzung ba'i cha'i dngos po ting nge 'dzin la tha mi dad par 'gyur zhing myur du zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i cha'i dngos po ting nge 'dzin la tha mi dad par 'gyur zhing myur du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The object-possessor aspect becomes undifferentiated in samādhi and quickly enters.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽thams cad la bzhugs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de ji lta bu yin zhe na / thams cad la bzhugs zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is that Vajrasattva like?🔽Present in all,

original: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rgyud la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: he is present in the continuum of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba'i shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa' 'byung ba'i shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the tantra of the knowledge of the arising of Vajrasattva,

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar shes pa sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yin no zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar shes pa sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yin no zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to fully teach that the attainment of buddhahood is the knowledge of the arising of the tathāgatas,

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud ces @180a * //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud ces @180a * //
translated: the Tantra of the Tathāgatas

original: bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is explained.

original: 'dod pas chags pa zhes bya ba la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ni 'dod pa de la chags pa ste yul la chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas chags pa zhes bya ba la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ni 'dod pa de la chags pa ste yul la chags pa'o //
translated: “Attachment to desire” means attachment to the objects of desire, namely, form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: dga' las bde zhes bya ba la 'dod pa la brten pa dga' ba'i sems las 'khor ba'i sems can rnams la bde ba 'byung ba'o //🔽bde ba las sdig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dga' las bde zhes bya ba la 'dod pa la brten pa dga' ba'i sems las 'khor ba'i sems can rnams la bde ba 'byung ba'o // bde ba las sdig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Happiness from joy” means that from the mind of joy based on desire, happiness arises for sentient beings in cyclic existence.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod pa'i sdig pa'o //🔽sdig pa las sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod pa'i sdig pa'o // sdig pa las sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Evil from happiness” means evil from engaging in the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod pa'i sdig pa'i dngos po de las mthong ba'i chos la gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la spyod pa'i sdig pa'i dngos po de las mthong ba'i chos la gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
translated: “Suffering from evil” means that from the reality of evil, which is engaging in the ten unwholesome courses of action, suffering arises in this life, such as being killed or imprisoned.

original: sdug bsngal las ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Concentration from suffering” means that from the reality of suffering, which is engaging in the ten unwholesome courses of action, concentration arises.

original: nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bas /
analyzed: nad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bas /
translated: Because of the arising of suffering such as illness,

original: 'khor ba'i skyon rnams rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon rnams rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one realizes the faults of cyclic existence.

original: de nas 'khor ba las sems skyo ba ste /
analyzed: de nas 'khor ba las sems skyo ba ste /
translated: Then, one becomes disenchanted with cyclic existence,

original: 'khor ba spang ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba spang ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: and in order to abandon cyclic existence, one generates meditative concentration.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal las ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal las ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, meditative concentration arises from suffering.

original: de khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of special qualities does it possess?

original: shin tu brtan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu brtan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said to be “extremely stable.”

original: chos bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis mi g-yo ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis mi g-yo ba'i phyir ;
translated: Because the meditative concentration of the selflessness of phenomena is unshaken by any conceptualization,

original: rdo rje bzhin du shin tu brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje bzhin du shin tu brtan pa yin no //
translated: it is extremely stable, like a vajra.

original: rdo rje nyid las sangs rgyas 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje nyid las sangs rgyas 'byung // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha arises from the vajra.

original: chos bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo rdo rje de las byung ba ste /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo rdo rje de las byung ba ste /
translated: The vajra, which has the nature of the meditative concentration of the selflessness of phenomena, arises from that vajra, which is the essence of Vajrasattva.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i gsang ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku'i gsang ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The secret body of Vairocana arises from that.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the tantra that is the knowledge of the origin of the tathāgatas,

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa'i rigs thams cad kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the yogis/yoginis of all the families, such as the Tathagata family,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa shes na rang rang gi rigs kyi dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes rab tu stan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa shes na rang rang gi rigs kyi dngos grub thob pa yin no zhes rab tu stan pa'i phyir /
translated: attain the powers of their respective families when they know the Tathagata family, etc.,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i de'i rgyud gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i de'i rgyud gsungs te /
translated: the Tantra of that is taught, beginning with “Then, etc.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud rigs de nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud rigs de nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The Tantra of the Tathagata family is called “the reality.”

original: sems dpa' byin gyis brlab pa'i sbyor bas /
analyzed: sems dpa' byin gyis brlab pa'i sbyor bas /
translated: By the yoga of the consecration of the hero,🔽the yogi/ni who has become Vajrasattva,

original: rdo rje sems dpar gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de @180b nyid rdo rje yid las byung ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du rnam par bsgoms na /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpar gyur pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de @180b nyid rdo rje yid las byung ba la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rang bzhin du rnam par bsgoms na /
translated: if he/she meditates on the nature of the Tathagata family, such as Vajramahi, etc.,

original: rdo rje yid las byung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje yid las byung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ro //
translated: he/she will become the nature of Vajradharma, etc.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje h'um mdzad dang / rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje h'um mdzad dang / rdo rje 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po ste /
translated: Likewise, Vajra Hūṃkara, Vajra Lokeśvara, and Ārya Ākāśagarbha.

original: de dag gi rigs kyi rang bzhin du de nyid bsgoms na de'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi rigs kyi rang bzhin du de nyid bsgoms na de'i rang bzhin can du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of “if one meditates on that nature, one will become of that nature,”

original: de nyid rdo rje'i rigs chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje'i rigs chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: it is said, “that very nature of the great vajra family,” and so on.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa'i 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyun bstan nas /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la sogs pa'i 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyun bstan nas /
translated: There, having taught the stream of knowledge of the origin of the tathāgata family, and so on,

original: da ni mngon par byang chub pa shes pas /
analyzed: da ni mngon par byang chub pa shes pas /
translated: now, in order to teach the meaning of “by knowing manifest enlightenment,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: the yogin of the tathāgatas

original: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: will become a tathāgata,”

original: de nas mngon par byang chub pa 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas mngon par byang chub pa 'byung ba shes pa'i rgyud ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Then, the stream of knowledge of the origin of manifest enlightenment.”

original: sems so sor rtogs pas ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems so sor rtogs pas ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “by realizing the mind” is the meaning of “by realizing the mind.”

original: rang nyid kyi sems ni rang sems te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad do //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sems ni rang sems te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad do //
translated: One's own mind is the eight collections of consciousness, such as the store-consciousness.

original: de dag so sor rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: de dag so sor rtogs pa ni //
translated: The realization of those is

original: aom tsitta pra ti bee dham ka ro mi /
analyzed: aom tsitta pra ti bee dham ka ro mi /
translated: Om citta-prativedham karomi.

original: zhes bya ba brjod cing gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod cing gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
translated: Saying that, one realizes the nature of the non-existence of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word ni is a definite article.

original: de nyid kho na las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kho na las so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means from that alone.

original: de las ci 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de las ci 'byung zhe na /
translated: What arises from that?

original: byang chub sems ni yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni yang dag 'byung //
translated: The arising of the thought of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba dang / byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems ni byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / byang chub kyi rang bzhin gyi sems ni byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the thought whose nature is enlightenment.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the nature of means and insight.

original: de yang dag par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de yang dag par 'byung ba ni /
translated: That arising is

original: aom bo dhi tsitta autp'a da y'a mi /
analyzed: aom bo dhi tsitta autp'a da y'a mi /
translated: Om bodhicitta-utpādayāmi.

original: zhes bya ba brjod nas de bskyed cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod nas de bskyed cing /
translated: Saying that, one generates that thought.

original: de ltar byung chub kyi sems bskyed nas sems dpa'i rdo rje bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar byung chub kyi sems bskyed nas sems dpa'i rdo rje bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having generated the enlightenment mind in that way, one should meditate on the nature of the Bodhisattva-vajra.

original: rdo rje nyid phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽aom tishtha badzra badzra a'atma ko& ham /🔽zhes bya ba brjod cing sems te rdo rje dang rdo rje'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje nyid phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te / aom tishtha badzra badzra a'atma ko& ham / zhes bya ba brjod cing sems te rdo rje dang rdo rje'i bdag nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, “because of the vajra nature.”🔽One should meditate on the vajra nature, saying “Om, the vajra is firm, I am the vajra nature.”

original: rdo rje nyid phyir shes par bya'o @181a * //
analyzed: rdo rje nyid phyir shes par bya'o @181a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, “because of the vajra nature, one should know.”

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that.

original: de nas sems dpa'i rdo rjer gyur pa'i sems de nyid /
analyzed: de nas sems dpa'i rdo rjer gyur pa'i sems de nyid /
translated: Then, that very mind which has become the Bodhisattva-vajra,🔽saying “Om, I am firm in all the tathagatas,” one should meditate on buddhahood.

original: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ti shtha aa ham zhes bya ba brjod cing sangs rgyas nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: aom ya th'a sarba ta th'a ga ta ti shtha aa ham zhes bya ba brjod cing sangs rgyas nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says,

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas rab tu bsgom //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas rab tu bsgom //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “one should meditate on oneself as the Buddha.”

original: sems dpa'i rdo rjer gyur pa'i sems de nyid rang gi bdag nyid kyis rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur bsgom pa ni //🔽bdag nyid sangs rgyas rab tu bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa'i rdo rjer gyur pa'i sems de nyid rang gi bdag nyid kyis rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur bsgom pa ni // bdag nyid sangs rgyas rab tu bsgom pa ste /
translated: That very mind which has become the vajra of the bodhisattva, visualizing it as the body of Vairocana,🔽is the visualization of oneself as a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas nyid de rnam par snang mdzad nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid de rnam par snang mdzad nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains buddhahood itself, which is Vairocana.
